review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Super Dino Rain Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Perfect for toddler who likes to play in the mud! Like that he can pull them on by himself.
review.name: Perfect toddler style

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Super Dino Rain Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Pretty sturdy and cute! Sides are a bit floppy which was a little funky for my 2 year old but they do the job.
review.name: Pretty cute

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Super Dino Rain Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: These are the best spring boots for toddlers! My granddaughter loves them!
review.name: Toddlers love them!

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Super Dino Rain Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: We just received these boots yesterday. As soon as my daughter put them on she slipped twice which is completely odd for rain boots. They came with some kind of oil on the bottoms, I guess to prevent them from cracking but I think customers should be warned. I wanted to return but she really wanted them, once we walked on the side walk the grip was great. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND FOR BABIES OR TODDLERS LEARNING TO WALK. Stick to the previous model, we owned that pair and never had that issue.
review.name: Boots should come with a warning

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Super Dino Rain Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: The perfect rain boot for my toddler to pull on and off herself. We wear them all the time! It's her favorite shoe.
review.name: Easy on/off for toddler

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Super Dino Rain Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Great for my 2 almost 3 year old! They are the perfect height so he is able to walk comfortably. They are also light weight but have been keeping his feet dry from all the rain and muddy puddle jumping. Would definitely recommend!
review.name: Perfect!!

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Super Dino Rain Boot - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots for my little grandson and he seems to like them. Great fit and true to size.
review.name: Great for kids

name: Skipper II Super Dino Rain Boot - Toddler Boys'

review.reviewBody: Liked the lining and the overall feel of the pullover but the outer fabric is not very durable. Wore it 3 times and with no rough use at all and there are threads unraveling in several locations affecting its appearance making it look rather shabby
review.name: Fabric not durable
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for leaving the review on our Men's Alt HB Pullover (2023). We're really sorry that it didn't fully meet your expectations on this occasion.

We are happy to assist in resolving all issues with any of our products. If you require further assistance, don't hesitate to get in touch with us via the website: https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us.

Thank you!
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] What I like: Octa yarn is an amazing insulator, very breathable, and the weight feels like you're wearing nothing, yet it magically keeps you warm. The Medium fits great for being 6'1 169lbs. 

What could be better: It's advertised for having "hand pockets", yet it only has one, but the pocket it has barely fits a hand. It would be nice to have full sized hand pockets as advertised. It also claims to have an interior pocket, which I haven't found yet. Believe this is an area where Marmot could improve, hire someone to make sure all of their copy is correct, as this I've seen happen on multiple other products. I have the jacket version of this, and love that, my only other concern is durability of the face material, but only time will tell.

Overall I love it and would recommend it, bummed about lack of hand pockets, but even without them it's a great layering piece, and one that can be used almost year round.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have tried it on, worn it around a bit, but not hiked in it yet.  That said, it provides more warmth than I expected with the mesh layer, and light weight.  I think it will be a nice hiking addition here in AZ as a peel off layer after cool morning starts.  I hike almost every day.
review.name: Nice Hiking Peel Off Layer for Cold Starts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pullover worked well for Fall mountain bike rides. Good breathability while also retaining heat, a good balance. Would recommend.
review.name: Great for Spring/Fall Mountain Biking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Breathable and warm! Looking forward to cooler weather & using this on the trails
review.name: Breathable and warm

review.reviewBody: These are highly underrated for how warm and breathable they are. Light and packs significantly smaller than a fleece of the same warmth. Size was spot on.
review.name: Tech sweatshirt without the sweat
Interesting Item & Backcountry's Shippin

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is an interesting piece. Light and way warmer than it should be for how it feels. The breathability is great and it blocks wind well. Its like having a tech sweatshirt as there is a layer of insulation, but you can work out without getting overheated.
review.name: Tech sweatshirt that is good for varying temps

review.reviewBody: Solid piece for staying warm while working out in subfreezing weather. Keeps the chill out but breathes well enough to not overheat
review.name: Alt HB

name: Alt HB Pullover Top - Men's

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Fairbanks Fingerless Glove - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fairbanks Fingerless Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Fairbanks Fingerless Glove - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought these gloves to use in scenarios where I need the dexterity of my bare fingertips but still want to get a little warmth.  I was wearing these gloves yesterday doing ham radio in a state park and got a little kick out of how just my fingertips were cold.  Duh.  Gave 4/5 star rating due to lack of any kind of grippy material on the palm.  If some suede or maybe rubber grip pads were sewn into the palm, it would be 5/5 for sure.
review.name: Nice gloves to add a little warmth when you still need your fingertips.

review.reviewBody: I have purchased probably four pairs of these -- all from the military exchange--and I keep them all over the house and in the car.  I appreciate that they are an affordable fingerless mitt that helps with my cold hands.  The only concern I have is that they pill fairly easily and I'd appreciate a response from Outdoor Research on this.  They are smooth when I get them but the fiber pills up.  I don't know how to prevent this.  That's my main feedback.  Maybe a different fiber would work better.
review.name: a useful and affordable option

review.reviewBody: I bought these gloves last fall - and used them daily to feed horses & work outside. Once it got down below 20 degrees, I had to change out to a different pair, but I love the comfort & the fact that even when wet, my hands stay warm.
review.name: reliable

review.reviewBody: The temperature has been fluctuating wildly in Toronto this winter and I needed something warm to keep in my coat pockets that weren't too bulky and still allowed me to easily grab treats from my sling pouch. This was a surprisingly tall order and took a lot of online research. I eventually found the Fairbanks gloves from OR and took the plunge. A decision that turned out to be an easy recommendation if you're looking for something that provides warmth, is packable, and won't hamper your digital dexterity!
review.name: Comfortable, warm, and exactly what I needed to walk our pup

review.reviewBody: Bought these gloves for my boyfriend and he loves them. Are warm and thick in the palms but allow your fingers to move and be free. Great purchase
review.name: Comfortable and sturdy

review.reviewBody: A great compromise in order to operate devices, use your finger dexterity, etc. They work great as liners to my ski gloves as well.
review.name: Best purchase I've made on gear this year

review.reviewBody: While these gloves are lacking some digits, (half of 10, to be exact), they make up for it in their absolute warmth and comfort. The wool used for these gloves is both sleek and comfy -- no itchy ragwool here! I love using fingerless gloves for most of the moderate-temperature NC hunting season, and have had bulky, itchy, loose fingerless gloves in the past. Not so with these babies! One downside though, they are not fireproof -- they do still singe if you get them too close to the fire while taking your coffee off the boil. :)
review.name: Partial Gloves, Wholly Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Cuts off circulation resulting in cold finger tips. My hands were warmer with no gloves on.
review.name: Too tight.

review.reviewBody: I use these gloves ice fishing all winter. I specifically like them for Lake Nipissing, in Ontario. It gets super cold (-30C) there and the wool keeps my hands warm if I'm unhooking a walleye, or setting up my hub. The open fingers still let's me put minnows on hooks, take walleye off hooks or crack my next beer. I love them! I think their only downside is they shrink VERY easily. As soon as they shrink, they do not fit my hands at all. So hand wash the minnow juice and walleye slim off them. But hands down best gloves. They're also great for adding a heat pad inside if you're hole hopping and chasing down walleye.
review.name: Love these for Ice Fishing

review.reviewBody: I made a good call. I usually wear a size large OR glove if it has fingers, but on these I chose the S/M. Honestly even that feels a little big. These should be made in the standard sizing as the other gloves and made to fit a little tighter.
review.name: The sizing is an issue but other than that good.

name: Fairbanks Fingerless Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: More expensive than other kid headlamps but cheaper in the long run as much more durable. Also has more features than other cheaper ones such that get more out of it in the mean time.
review.name: Kid proof

review.reviewBody:
C'mon BD, such and awesome and well thought out kids light except the packaging. We just bout an IBM ThinkPad that came with no plastic packaging and everything recyclable. This light had two plastic boxes both marked "5" which is basically non-recyclable where most people live.
BD is an outdoor brand you can do better! and I still love you but c'mon
review.name: Great Lamp, Terrible Packaging

review.reviewBody: Easy to use and bright enough for the little one around camp.
review.name: Great for the kiddo

review.reviewBody:
I bought 3, one each for the 7yr old, 5 yr old and 3 yr old. They all love them. The color changing option is not useful, but way fun and occupies them when other camp chores require them not to help.

The straps are less than awesome, the tail end keeps coming out of the retention loop and ends up dangling. So maybe upgrade the headband.
review.name: The kids love it!

review.reviewBody: I bought this headlamp for reading in bed, as my normal one is too bright. The amount and quality of light from the Wiz is perfect for that task, and also doesnt bother my wife. Win!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Kids love the light especially when it changes colors. Batteries included are a bonus for parents
review.name: Works well

review.reviewBody: Great fun light to have around the house for kids to grab and use
She absolutely loves using this headlamp. She even likes wearing it is a necklace. The fact that it will automatically shut off helps out greatly in saving battery life with little people.
review.name: Great for the kiddo!

review.reviewBody: This head lamp is great for the kids and doesn't blind everyone on camping trips. Great light.

Overall this was great, but functionally it's limited. My daughter loves it, has fun playing and switching the colors. Basement forts and backyard camping is a lot more fun because of it. But as an actual headlamp for hiking in the dark, it's kind of limited because it's really just the main light that can be used - no focus or wide functionality. But I knew that going in, so I'm not disappointed. Just want others to be aware in case that's what they are looking for.
review.name: Great for Kids Wanting Fun

name: Wiz Headlamp

review.reviewBody:
My wife and I purchased Showers Pass Elite 2.1 jackets mid-year 2015. The short of it is if you are looking for an exceptional cycling rain jacket that can also double as sub-freezing temperature winter riding outer layer this is the jacket for you. 

I am an Assos fan, but you just can not find a better rain (versus shower) riding jacket in my opinion. On long hard climbs or all-out 20 mph plus flats it is easy to regulate your body heat and moisture control using the "pit-zips" with waterproof zippers. I love the long drop tail to keep the road spray off my butt. 

The cut (size L for me, 5'10", 168 Lbs.) is "drop bar comfortable", roomy enough to accommodate a base layer, winter riding  jersey, and a snug cut Assos Airjack 851 jacket and not be constricted, yet a clean enough cut that it does not flap in the wind when wearing a light base layer and summer jersey underneath. 

Great 3M reflective trim to keep you visible to drivers when light conditions are poor. The left-side chest media pocket is a great pocket to keep your phone or credit card/cash stash easily accessible without having to grope through multiple under layers. 

The Velcro cuffs make it easy to snug up and tuck into your gloves. 

These jackets work so well that not only do we use them for cycling, we also find them being our go-to rain jackets on camping trips, our after-dark dog walks, and our winter running jackets.  

As this is written the jackets have been on the go for the better part of five and half years, they literally have a lot of miles one them, and they are standing up wonderfully. Highly recommend and we would by them again. 

NOTE: we also purchased the Showers Pass Rain Hood which attaches via Velcro tabs to this and other Showers Pass jackets. The basic design and quality of the hood is great, however I wish they would make the wraparound  'neck-throat" piece a little longer. I typically wear a 16-inch neck shirt. With stand-up collars on the Showers Pass Elite 2.1 I find the neck-throat closure on the hood could use an inch or so more length to keep it comfortable. I did contact Showers Pass and suggested that to them. Hopefully they will or have acted on that.
review.name: A superior rain and cold weather jacket!

name: Elite 2.1 Jacket  - Men's
Elite 2.1 Jacket  - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: As advertised - they are warm and they are waterproof.  I am a huge fan of Merrill's having owned 5 or 6 pair of Moab 2's but even when they are marketed a such, they are not waterproof.  Two years ago I did find a pair of Merrill's that were waterproof but when the uppers finally gave way, this particular model had disappeared from their website.  Enter the Thermo Mid Waterproof. I don't know if these are the next step in the evolutionary development of the previous outdoor Merrill boot but these are better on every level. They are warm, they are waterproof and they are comfortable for any activity I asked of them outdoors.  As a real "waterproof" and insulated boot, you don't want to wear them indoors all day because your feet will sweat, but in the snow or in the rain, they will keep your feet warm and dry. The sole tracks are deep so they offer excellent traction and they give you great confidence, especially in changing conditions and on inclined trails.
review.name: They are the real deal!
comment: Thank you for the great feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: i used them to hike a snow covered, tamped down, trail in Breckenridge Colorado. I also used them to walk around the town of Breckenridge as well. the shoes performed well.  i have only used them for one week, so i cannot talk about durability

review.itemreviewed: Endorphin Edge Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I just want to preface this by saying I am and have been a huge fan of Saucony for a while back to when the kinvaras were one of the newest light weight trainers on the market.  For the past 10 years Ive exclusively run in Saucony shoes. I currently have 2 endorphin speed 3s, the endorphin pro 3, and 3 pairs of Kinvara 13 in my rotation.

I took up trail running last year, so naturally I gravitated to the peregrine line.  The fit and comfort were good, so I bought several pairs.  Unfortunately the durability of this shoe is very poor.  The uppers would rip through and the lugs would get worn down very quickly and after a month or two the lugs/sole just rips off.  In the beginning I thought it was just me, as I admit, I am quite rough on them.  But in the past season Ive gone through about 5 peregrines, 2 peregrine gore tex, and 1 endorphin edge.  The sole rips off and the lugs get worn down so quickly.  Why did I keep buying them? I guess Im a fool and a sucker for saucony so I never thought of buying anything else.  I wanted to run through the mountains doing my best impression of Racin Grayson. 

So I signed up for a 50 mile ultra. I had nothing to wear to the dance so I panicked and bought another pair of the endorphin edge trail runners a week before the race.  Even though they arent that durable, they are a fast shoe and theyre comfortable even while running on the road.  I did two easy shakeout runs on the track, and the race. So Ive run in these 3 times and they are breaking down.  

So while I will still buy the road shoes, this was the last straw and Im giving up on the trail runners until things improve.
review.name: Poor durability

review.itemreviewed: Endorphin Edge Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: After 25 years, I finally found my perfect thru-hiking and fast packing shoe! Im 65, 240 pounds. Not only does this shoe have a crazy amount of cushion, but the carbon fiber plate and rock plate protect the bottom of my feet from rock bruises. The carbon fiber plate makes all the difference. These shoes are incredibly light, dry super fast and are extremely comfortable. I have about 80 miles of technical trail/off trail hiking on these and am surprised at how little wear they show. I really hope that Saucony does not change a thing on these shoes, but I bought 2 extra pairs just in case.
review.name: Finally, a perfect fast packing/trail running shoe

review.itemreviewed: Endorphin Edge Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been wearing Saucony for many years.  As I have gotten older, my feet have needed a larger toe box.  The Endorphin Edge gives me the toe box I need along with the right amount of arch support and cushioning.  I bought a second pair and trade off wearing them daily.
review.name: The Best Yet

review.itemreviewed: Endorphin Edge Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love these shoes! They fit just right, perfect for a wider foot. They are super comfortable on the road too! Light weight and great traction, I recommend.
review.name: Great shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Endorphin Edge Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ordered and after more than a week was canceled by no reason. Very disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Endorphin Edge Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Like this shoe. More nimble than the Hoka Speedgoats Ive been wearing for the past 5 years, but would prefer the Speedgoats with their cushioning for anything involving pavement.  Fit is true to size with a roomy toe box. Used them on dirt and dry sandstone, havent had them on wet granite, yet.
review.name: Good shoe

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and looks nice. A few caveats: if you're short-waisted (as I am), the high waist will only shorten yours more; the crotch rides a little low in the front. The adjustable straps are great and the smocking makes it easy to get in and out of. The fabric along the hips (by the pockets) was a little lumpy, so I sewed a new seam to smooth it out and that seemed to work. As another reviewer mentioned, the fabric may stretch during wear - I worry that it'll make the backside sag, but we'll see. I'm 5'5", 135 lb, 34DD with a 30" waist and 36" hips and got the small.

review.reviewBody:
I ordered a medium in this jumpsuit and swapped it for a small. I am 5'2" and 135 lbs so a really small person would definitely need to size down. It also does stretch some and I do worry about it stretching out a lot considering the only way to get it on and off is to pull it over your hips. This is super comfortable and not see through at all. Love the pockets and adjustable straps too! On my 5'2" frame the length hits right at my ankles. I've also been able to dress it up by wearing a button-down shirt and tying it at the waist. 

Time will tell how it holds up, but for now I see myself wanting to live in this jumpsuit!

review.reviewBody: The pants fit and feel great when climbing. Has enough room for all my gear with big pockets. One thing it should have had from the beginning but I had to add on after is an elastic closure on the legs. That way The open leg loops don't get in the way when climbing, fortunately it's a really easy modification to do
review.name: Great but really need one addition

review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair of Talus pants. In the last five years of so, a few changes have made them not quite as awesome. First, the fit is baggier and larger. They were never slim, so now they're quite floppy. Second, the fabric is maybe a touch thicker and heavier. 

Third and most important, the pockets are smaller and not positioned as well. The best thing about the old version was the deep deep front and rear pockets. I could store a phone, a couple snacks, and a headlamp on a long route and never worry about them falling out or having my mobility impaired. now i'm not sure where my phone goes as the pockets aren't deep enough.

All that said, they're still a synthetic, stretchy climbing pant with four pockets and a drawstring, which elevates them above 90% of the "climbing pants" out there.
review.name: Not as good as previous version

review.reviewBody: I like the fit and general feel of this pant. The sizing is generous through the legs which is key for me. Strangely, the waist of the S fits me well although by that metric I should probably be in a size M. The material is comfortable, has a nice stretch and after several months is holding up well. The pockets are voluminous but have no zip closure to secure any important items. The waist has quite a bit of elastic for retention and has a drawcord that must be tied. The waist button is the main issue as it readily saws through its thread; using this pant for any length of time will require replacing this button with something else (the metal one has sharp edges right where the thread lies). This may not seem like a huge problem overall, but a pant that retails for $100 really should do better. If sewing a button isn't an issue, these are worth it.
review.name: Decent Pant With One Annoying Issue

review.reviewBody: My waist size is 33 and the size Large pant is uncomfortably snug. Ive got several pair from previous seasons and they all fit great. These however do not.
review.name: Who sizes this stuff?

name: Talus Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Very disappointed with these gore-tex shoes (mine are orange ones). Got in rain and my socks were wet and feet cold:(
Though they are light and comfy, but the fact they are not waterproof ruins everything:(
review.name: Not waterproof at all!

review.reviewBody: From the minute I put them on they were extremely comfortable. Ive done at least 50 K in the first week and not a sign of anywhere whatsoever. I have done all different types of trails are soft buggy and feet were still dry. Highly recommend.
review.name: Incredibly good trail shoes

review.reviewBody: Have had the shoes for just about a month and have used them mostly for walks with the dogs in the PNW where we are entering the rainy season. Have had zero wet or cold toes. Also using for soccer practice on the wet turf and grass. Excellent. Now that we are in the rainy season I am wearing them almost every day.
review.name: Excellent water resistance

review.reviewBody: as usual, sizing is erroneously off and off-putting--why the inconsistency with this company? Hassle to return for improper consistency.
review.name: Not true to size
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.reviewBody: Love the shoes. Havent used them yet since they were purchased for a trip coming up soon
review.name: Elixir activ gore-tek

review.reviewBody: Bought these as a replacement for my much loved Salomon Veyas now worn out. Bit sturdier, great speedy shoe.
review.name: Great shoes.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable for hiking and tail walking. Size is perfect.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: I walk a lot in the redwood forest near where I live and on the beach. These shoes fit my feet perfectly! I can tighten them up with the laces so that they dont slop around, and best of all they seem to have more padding on the bottom of my foot. Just great overall.
review.name: Greatest walking shoes ever!

review.reviewBody: I bought a second pair of these shoes as I loved them so much! Excellent for walking. So comfortable and I feel that they position my foot correctly and therefore minimise knee and hip discomfort. I love the roll that I feel through the shoe as I walk, it aids my walking gait.
review.name: Best shoe ever!!

review.reviewBody:
Good feet support, comfortable in all terrain...
Also after the long day feel like feathers. I love my new Salomon footwear.
review.name: From Bolivia to Machu Pichu all days hiking

name: Elixir Activ GTX Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I was in an accident years ago that left my foot and ankle covered in skin grafts with extensive nerve damage. I have tried on almost every boot in the market and the Dialogue is the first boot where I have zero pain.
review.name: The only boot for my messed up foot

review.reviewBody: Solid boot. 1 year of use, I recommend size down half a size to avoid heel lifts. Currently have terrible heel lift & enforces me to tighten the BOA extremely. Cuts off circulation.
review.name: Solid boot. Size down

review.reviewBody: I love these boots on my 3rd pair now. Right amount of stiffness and ultra durable
review.name: Best heel hold on the market

review.reviewBody:
Had my '22-'23 model heat molded, was alright between day 10-20, and then progressively got way way worse.
After about 60 days, I needed a full butterfly wrap and aftermarket insole to stop the heel lift, which was just horrific.
On that note, stock insole is garbage, replace that immediately if you do buy these. 

Positives: If you're looking for a very soft boot, this might be for you. This thing is very very flexible and bendy. Tweaks for days. Haven't experienced any issues with the boa thus far yet, and its been full 6-8 hour days of use for the last 60-70 riding days, bell to bell.
review.name: clapped out quickly
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody:
Got fitted with these as they fit a narrower foot than Burton ions I had previously. Likening the easy dual boa and ankle lace holds excellent.
Boa does seem to come loose after a run or two, but I am riding pretty hard through trees and powder and it is easy to click back to the right spot. I could be over tightening?
 The boots seem like they will be durable and are made of 20% recycled material.
review.name: Sung ankle, good for medium or narrow foot

review.reviewBody:
These boots just feel right. 
I jumped right into these and hit Whistler without the need to break them in. I am so happy I went with these, not only for all the amazing features like dual boa, lightness, and comfort, but I love the extra protection on the toe.
review.name: Love these boots

review.reviewBody: I have serious foot problems and cycle through a lot of boots.  I have a hard time getting a boot stiff enough that does not kill my feet.  I have a wide foot also.  I wear a lot of Solomon shoes so I decided to try these boots.  I backcountry Splitboard and resort ski.  I have used them 11 times for backcountry splitboarding so far and they are great. These boots have been a Godsend.  I bought a second pair to use at the resort and to have a backup.
review.name: Feet Problems

name: Dialogue Dual BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody: I purchased these to replace the Outpulse which was discontinued. As much as I liked the Outpulse, this is an improvement. I've been buying Salomon for years and they never disappoint.
review.name: Another great show from Salomon!

review.reviewBody: These look cool but I don't think they are designed well. I wore them probably a total of 5 times and in that time got the two worst ankle twists of my life. I never wore them again and am putting them in the trash where they belong. The problem is the sole is super wide and grippy, so it easily catches on things and puts a lot of torque on your foot, but the ankle is very low, so provides no help in resisting that torque. I have loved Salomon shoes in the past but these are terrible. Avoid these!
review.name: Worse than bad, they are dangerous!

review.reviewBody:
I'm a mailman so I do a lot of walking. I want to like the shoe but these are its problems:

1. They're not actually waterproof, your feet will get wet.
2. As someone previously mentioned, the shoe "clicks" and is severely annoying and impractical. 
3. Mine have torn at the inner foot bunion area. I don't really have bunions, nor have I had other shoes tear there normally.

If these points could be corrected, then GREAT SHOE 5/5. Otherwise, the problems listed are quite drastic so honestly, 1/5.

I'd simply have to recommend a different shoe. These do look nice and walk nicely though.
review.name: Problem
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: From the moment that I first put this shoe on I knew that it was going to be a great trail shoe! The footbed cradles your foot and the shoe holds your foot secure and provides exceptional stability. The Gore-Tex interior ensures that your feet stay dry and the well-cushioned sole with deep legs keep your feet happy and secure on a majority of road/trail types. This is an all around excellent trail shoe!
review.name: Salomon Elixir Active Gore-Tex Trail Shoe
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

name: Elixir Activ GTX Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I got this for climbing in the fall/winter and the durability exceeds my expectations. I boulder in it and haven't ripped it once. It can brush against pokey trees and branches, and still not a rip in sight. Impressed. It's also super stretchy so even with a couple of layers underneath, I still do'nt feel restricted.
review.name: So durable!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is the best, I used it in Colorado on a snow snowshoe adventure in Rocky Mountain Park in February. Kept me dry and warm against negative temps. Light weight and warm, better then bulky puffy jacket. The sizing is accurate.
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket in the olive color. I too find that it stains incredibly easy and even on places that nothing spills on which I don't understand. Oil from my neck and face stains the collar as well. I have found however, that Dawn dish soap works pretty well. I just squirt a little to cover the spots, let it sit for bit and then put it in the wash on cool or cold with a little tide. (by the way, this works on any clothing that you spill grease or oil on). Comes clean every time. It is a pain in the butt to keep doing this, however I love the fit of the jacket (I am apple shape and I appreciate it not being so form fitting) and it's very light and still warm. Perfect for New England winter.
review.name: Stains easily, but fixable

review.reviewBody: This is a fantastic active down jacket whether you're out climbing or just running errands around town. It's got all the features you want- fleece lined pockets, stretchy fabric, elastic cuffed wrists, double zippers; plus it's incredibly cozy. I love wearing it on cold mornings when I'm out guiding in the desert. I am in-between medium and large in MHW clothes so I got a large so it would be nice and roomy for layers, though I don't often need very many because it's so warm! Highly recommend this jacket!
review.name: My favorite down jacket

review.reviewBody:
This down hoody is amazing. It is the perfect weight for staying warm without the bulk. The baffled construction ensures that there are no cold spots anywhere. The best part is the super soft and stretchy outer fabric. I was simply amazed that I never felt restricted in the hoody even when wearing a more form fitted jacket.  
I am 53 and 120 lbs and I am fairly small but have broad shoulders. The size chart suggested a size small but I opted for a size medium instead. The smaller size would have worked fine if using the down hoody for an insulating layer under a shell but it felt a bit too tight for wearing over a couple of base layers. The size medium fit me perfectly. 
As a fulltime mountain guide I get out into many diverse environments for days at a time. I field-tested the down hoody during a desert on a rock-climbing trip. Temperatures were near freezing at night and around mid 60s to 70 during the days with a few cold and stormy days. The hoody was incredibly warm and comfortable. I wore it on several hiking trips and it moved well with my body. I was amazed at how durable the soft fabric was. I brushed up against many prickly and sharp things and never got any tears. I also wore the hoody as a belay parka and it was perfect during the frosty mornings. The bottom zipper zips up allowing easy access to the belay loop. The hood fits over the helmet about  of the way so it is never blocking the view or feeling cumbersome. The chest pocket is perfect for a cellphone and the hand warmer pockets are super soft.
review.name: WOW! Amazing down hoody

review.reviewBody: I'm a climber on the Front Range of Colorado and I need gear that can keep up with rapidly changing weather conditions. I'm a medium and this puffy fits true to size with a bit of room for layering. They added a bottom zipper to this most recent version of the Stretchdown Hoody, which is a great improvement that allows access to a belay device on cold mornings at the crag. The 700 fill is nice and warm without being suffocating, and the big puffy hood fits over a helmet. The Stretchdown material allows full range of motion with no constriction around the underarms when you reach across your body. Good for belaying, camping, walking your dog, whatever!
review.name: Stretchy and Warm

review.reviewBody:
I am rock climber and mountaineer. I used this Womens Stretch Down Hoody for my recent hikes and climbs in Canyons of Utah. Since the days are short post fall,  we need good warmth while backpacking, belaying and climbing. It provides real good insulation, thanks for 700 fill. It's slightly longer over the waist which is what I always needed from my puffy jacket.

I am usually an S and this S fit is great. Can be used in addition with fleece or down vest if going for winter camping or adventure activities in colder temperatures. 

Best part is the design which considers all kinds of motion that we do in outdoor activities. This is a must take if you are going to climb or belay in chilly weather. It is durable, packability is great and hood is the best part.
review.name: Must have, great for athletic outdoorsy activities

name: Stretchdown Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have now had 2 early season days skiing with this HS jacket in rain, ice, snow and wind and it performed very nicely. Like others, I would like another pocket or 2 but this is not a deal breaker. I exchanged a few messages with Mammut CS regarding the hard to slide 2 way zipper. The 2 way zipper is one of the reasons I bought this but I was afraid to use a zipper lubricant on a new $700 jacket without the OK from Mammut. I carefully used a damp Q-tip to apply a very small bit of silicone to the full length of the zipper and then wiped it off with another Q-tip. This seemed to have done the trick. Yes, the zipper is left handed and this takes a little adjustment as well. The color (BLUE) is amazing and also part of the reason I kept this model over the Stony HS.
review.name: Love my Mammut Norwand

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love this jacket, super well made, water/wind protection is excellent. Top notch
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket. Have worn it mountaineering and it stops all wind while breathing perfectly.  10/10.

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: The quality of materials is top notch and the attention to detail on the build is great.  Very well made jacket.  Absolutely rock solid in the rainy/heavy wet snow of the inland northwest.  The pocket placement took a little getting used to but if youre standing around with your hands in your pockets, this is probably not the best jacket for you.  The material is louder than expected but after a very wet winter and no leaks, Im fine with a little crunchy.
review.name: Great jacket, great fit!

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Coat is very breathable and light. However, I wish it had a little more pockets and was quieter. It is very crinkly when moving, and did not seem to break in much over the course of the ski season. Overall still a great coat but could use a couple improvements!
review.name: Great shell

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This jacket has so far lived up to the hype. I've been able to take it hiking in New Zealand and around the PnW and its held up well to the rain, wind, and a little bushwacking. It feels very well constructed, and while I would've loved front pockets, the storage and design are well thought out. The pit zips are well designed and easy to use (maybe the easiest out of any i've tried), and offer good ventilation while moving. This jacked is overkill for daily city use, but if you're going up into the mountains or live in a rainy place its well worth the money. 5'11 185lbs in a Large fits very well with a few light layers underneath
review.name: Burly, breathable, and well designed hardshell

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Works perfect for ice climbing, hiking, mountaineering. 59, 176lb size M.
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very breathable and comfortable.   Fit is good and arm length is perfect.  Great for backcountry tours and in-bounds storm days.
review.name: Solid Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Amazing shell. Great for skiing both resort and backcountry. Wish there was lower pockets or an arm pocket for a ski pass but otherwise an amazing jacket.
review.name: Great shell

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is great, love the color, great performance. It is a tailored fit in the torso, so take that into consideration for sizing. That said, I was still able to wear a heavier mid layer underneath if needed without sizing up. I've worn this in some pretty wet snow and warmer weather, as well as cold/ windy days and still stayed dry and at a comfortable temp
review.name: Good quality, tailored fit

name: Nordwand Advanced HS Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love this sweatshirt on cooler days. It is pretty heavy so it is great to wear on a cooler day with a to layer. I've had it for several months and it is definitely holding up and looking like what I originally bought.
review.name: Great fit and quality

review.reviewBody: Finally a thick cozy sweater! Absolutely love this sweater. The necks a little snug and the hood is a bigger than normal, but this is what adds the coziness factor. Will definitely be buying more colours.
review.name: Super thick and cozy

review.reviewBody:
I've owned this sweater for about 6 months, the paint used for the branding/logo has started to flake off and little bits of tiny plastic get everywhere.  I've been very careful with washing on delicate cycle and haven't even put in the dryer, only line dry.  Pretty disappointed, paint is terrible quality.

If it wasn't for that it would be a pretty nice sweatshirt.
review.name: Brading Logo paint flakes off

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit.  Excellent quality.  If you want something that will last you, its worth the cost.

Bought this over a month ago and product is holding up nicely. Perfect for a Chicago winter. I was a little itchy at first but broke in after 1/2 wears. I will be looking for more sweaters from them in the future.
review.name: Warm texture

review.reviewBody: The Large Hoodie is really XL is very large.  The hood is for a very large head twice as large as my head.  The hoodie is very thick and warm which I like and feels substantial.
review.name: The hoodie is very thick and warm

review.reviewBody: Like everything at Fjallraven this shirt is of excellent quality.  You can tell the difference between this shirt and similar ones by other brands.  Absolutely love it and I will be ordering more. The one issue is the tags.  Everything at FJ has these numerous, large tags. Shirts, hats, backpacks.  These tags got to go!  Plus theyre sewn in too deep, makes cutting them out a risk to damaging the item.
review.name: Excellentone issue.

review.reviewBody: The vest is light. The warmth is insufficient. The vest is extremely short. The cut of the vest is poorly made and the quality is not in keeping with the brand. Honestly, I do not recommend the vest to any consumer. I do not recommend buying the vest even during the biggest sale of the year.
review.name: Terrible vest.

review.reviewBody: Just like the fleece vests I bought from Patagonia and REI 40 (?) years ago. Fits great and hopefully is with me for the next 20 years!
review.name: Awesome Retro Vest!

review.reviewBody: My husband wears a medium in every shirt, and coat. I purchased a medium, and it was entirely too small. Now Im having to pay money to return it. I wouldnt buy this product unless you are sizing up. And returns are very difficult with this company.
review.name: A medium is like a small

review.reviewBody: The item was delivered free in three days in CA. Ordered the green in XS. My chest measures 35 inches in circumference. There is still ample room for a shirt and under shirt or layering. It is thinner than my other Patagonia Better Fleece vests. Stitching is nice and clean-good quality  control. I wear it under a denim jacket or sports blazer. I love the fit and happy with my purchase. Hope this helps.
review.name: Nice Green Vest

review.reviewBody:
This one is a WINNER all around.   Not too thick (heavy) nor is it too thin.  Just right.  Sizing at XL is just right.  Color works well with most of my work shirts.  It's a KEEPER!  It's probably going to be my closet favorite now.

The only thing I didn't like was the shipping.  It took 10 days from date of order to date of receipt.  Not sure if that's normal.  Shipped from Backcountry as DHL SmartMail Parcel Expedited, but dropped off to me via US Postal Service.
review.name: Not returnable.....why?  I'm KEEPING it!

review.reviewBody: Pretty disappointed with this vest. The fact that is was labeled as midweight, I was expecting something much more substantial. It seemed very thin. The lining on the inside was weird. I had to send it back. For the money, I think there are far better options.
review.name: Disa

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Light Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody:
Years ago I purchased a bunch of Smartwool Classic Hike light cushion crew socks in taupe color.  Absolutely loved them, wore like iron.  Actually wore them for years  until the heels started wearing out.  Threw them out one sock at a time till they were all dead.  100% satisfied and wanted to buy more of them!

Had one heck of a time finding them.  Looked and looked, no luck. I THINK they stopped making them for a bit.  Finally gave up and order DarnTough socks to replace them.  Great socks, but they were a little too tight on my feet, like to wiggle my toes and really could not.  Then ordered a size larger but then they were too long.  Sent them all back.

Then I was looking on Backcountry website and there they were, the Smartwool Classic Hiker Crew sock in Taupe, oh happy day!  BUT, I did not remember exactly what cushion style  I had with the original socks, ended up ordering twice but finally figured out that it was the light cushion style.  The new sock is now supposed to be partially made with recycled material.  Wasn't too keen on that but willing to give it a try.

Socks arrived and they looked just like my original pair, nice!  Put them on and they definutely felt different, less dense is the best way to put it.  I thought it may by because of the reclaimed material.  But I was willing to give them a try.  Was hoping with washing the cushion material would matte down a bit and get "denser".  And I'm happy to say that is just what happened.  You have to remember that my image of my old socks was after wearing them for litterally years, they were well matted!  When new they probably felt the same way.

The problem I have with the new socks was unexpected, it's not the sock material, it's the stitching.  I bought 10 pair so I would not run out again.  All washed and in a box on my closet shelf.  Grab one off the top when I need a pair and when washed they go back in the box on top again.  So the top socks get more wear/washing than the bottom ones.  In the time I've had these socks, ordered 2/16/23 many of them have had the stitching on the top cuff come apart so you end up with a "roll" of sock at the top, not a flat band.  It's happening to the point that I think they will all eventually do it.  Also, I've had one, maybe two socks have the stitching on the toe seam fail, just a little bit, maybe just under 1/4" long?  I still wear the socks as the toes do not stick out, but it should not be happening.

Loved my old socks, wore them for many years, never had a single seam or stitch ever fail on them.  Would love my new socks just as much if they used better material in the stitching.
I have a call into SW to see what they have to say.  I'm hoping others have pointed this out and they have upgraded their stitch material.

I really dislike giving less than 5 star reviews but had to in this case.  Fix the stitching material and this would be a solid 5 star plus sock again.

Wade
review.name: Material and Stitching has changed

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Light Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: Ordered alpine blue thinking it was more of a gray & light / pale blue situation. Definitely a dark blue/navy and white color way. Will definitely still work just fine (use outweighs color preference), but a heads up to anyone shopping this that its definitely not gray toned in any way. Just super navy!
review.name: Comfortable  but coloring is off

name: Classic Hike Light Cushion Crew Sock

review.reviewBody: not comfortable and doesnt rock well. I am returning it
review.name: Im returning this chair
comment:
Hello, thank you for leaving the review on our Cross Rocker Outdoor Rocking Chair. We're really sorry that it didn't fully meet your expectations on this occasion. We are happy to assist in resolving all issues with any of our products. If you require further assistance, don't hesitate to get in touch with us directly.  
Thank you!

review.reviewBody: it is what it appeared while shopping and so far its light weight and sturdy. the cup holder seems to be good too
review.name: great for musicians

review.reviewBody: 2 stars coz it is not comfy and they could have raised the back rest to support neck and a part of the head. Then it would've been perfecto! Construction is solid! Arm rest is low and perfect so that special someone to sit on your lap! (Max 300lbs load) Seat is wide and good. Cup holder is nice addition. Im returning mine. I'll wait till they can extend the back rest. There is still space for it when you fold.
review.name: Back rest short, uncomfortable
comment:
Hello!

Thank you for your feedback. We're sorry to hear that our chair fell short of your expectations. We constantly make sure that consumers' feedback and concerns are communicated when we are searching for ways to improve our product and service.

For further questions or inquiries, you may also visit our contact us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, good looking chair. Love the rocking.
review.name: Rocked my world

review.reviewBody: These are awesome chairs.  The typical folding camp chairs you buy just flat out arent comfortable.  You cant sit in them for very long. Not these babies. Kick back and relax in front of the campfire for hours without a care in the world.   The quality leaves a little to be desired. Some of the seams started to rip and required mending after some use and you can forget about the built in cup holders. They dont support a drink of any weight.  But for a rocking chair I can pack down in my car and take anywhere, its well worth it.
review.name: Wonderful Alternative to Traditional Camp Chairs

review.reviewBody: Had issues with the bolts rattling loose and the pipes falling out. Looks cool and is comfy but wouldn't buy again.
review.name: Just okay
comment:
Hi, Matt P.

Thank you for contacting Coleman, The Outdoor Company. Were sorry to hear that your Cross Rocker Chair has issues with the bolts and pipes. We appreciate you for taking the time bringing this up to us and can imagine how inconvenient this must be. Please know that this is not the type of experience that we want you to have here at Coleman. We'll make sure that your feedback is shared with our team. Please accept our heartfelt apologies for any inconvenience our products may have caused you. If theres something specific we can help with, feel free to reach us out anytime, and we'll be more than happy to help.

Thank you and have a wonderful day!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Chair is great. I feel it's made really well.  The colors of Red and Black go so well together.  The cup holder is a great idea.  I know I will use it alot.  I absolutely love that the chair is a Rocker. It's very comfortable.
review.name: Love this Rocker!

review.reviewBody:
Definitely like this chair its very comfortable.
The only downside is the cup holder.
Regardless I would still buy this chair again. I feel its a great camping chair
review.name: Cross Rocker Chair review

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cross rocker chair is perfect for at the campground! We love sitting around the fire and relaxing. This chair is so comfortable and easy to rock in. This chair has sturdy black material that you sit on with a fun red colored cross rocker base. One side also has a cup holder. The chair unpacks nicely and is super easy to assemble. When we are done camping the chair easily folds up and straps together. The chair works great for an adult but my son loves to be in this chair. We all enjoy the soft, rocking movement or just sitting still in it. Coleman is a great brand that I've always thought of when making purchases for camping.
review.name: So Comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Coleman cross rocker chair in black is by far the best. My sons play multiple sports and this chair comes with me everywhere. It is comfortable, durable and easy to transport. I bring it with me everywhere and get compliments every time I use it. It is super comfortable for those long days on the field and folds up in a breeze!
review.name: Comfortable and durable

name: Cross Rocker Chair

review.reviewBody: First off, Fjallraven as a brand is really good. This Ovik Fleece is really well sized. I'm 6'3" 210 lb, and it fits perfect with plenty of sleeve length, which is rare for me. Unfortunately, I cannot say the material used will hold up. After wearing it 4 times and washing it twice, it's starting to pill. Worth noting this type of fleece attracts every tiny piece of lint or hair. It's a magnet. Too bad. If this was in cotton or some other durable material it would be a winner. At this point I'm stuck with trying to remove the pilling and only wear it occasionally. Not a good long lasting durable fleece.
review.name: Almost perfect, but doubt it'll last.

review.reviewBody:
I was eager to check out a non-leather climbing shoe without sacrificing performance. These shoes fit the bill. Comfortable heel hooks, amazing grip, non-smelly, and solid toe hooks. Upgrade from my Tenaya Oasi shoes (solid shoes, just like these Skwamas much more)

I usually wear a mens 10 for everyday shoes. I sized down to a 42 (9 US), but returned those for a half size smaller (41.5) pair which perfectly worked out. Basically a 1.5 size down worked well for this shoe. 

Overall summary: Next level non-leather climbing shoes that do everything well.
review.name: The best non-leather climbing shoes

review.reviewBody: I've had the leather Skwama's for years, and love them, but I wanted to move towards a vegan shoe to reduce my impact on animal products. This shoe was slightly tighter to get into and had a slower break in, but it did break in and feels pretty awesome on my feet. I'm impressed with the climbing abilities of this shoe and don't see any limitations.
review.name: Solid Vegan Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: This is an amazing climbing shoe.  I have never been able to wear La Sportiva due to the fact that I have wide feet, but after searching endless reviews online about the original Skwama, I found out that it fits wide feet very well.  The color scheme on these shoes speaks for itself; pretty much the reason I bought them haha.  I love overhanging climbing and these excel there, but are great on slabs and vertical walls as well.  The split sole really allows you to engage your foot and smear; but they are at home on overhung terrain.  It uses the Vibram XS Grip 2, which I LOVE.  Super sticky and soft rubber.  I just sized them like my street shoes, no crazy downsizing as these don't stretch and personally for me there was virtually no break-in time which is amazing.  If you're looking for a super soft and accurate shoe with great feedback, this is hard to beat.  And, you cannot beat the color scheme.  Great shoe for people with wide feet.
review.name: Skwama Vegan

name: Skwama Vegan Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought this hat to replace a standard cap i was wearing with my raincoat to keep rain out of my face and it works like a dream! The old cap would start leaking and inevitably stop serving a purpose. But not this one! I have worn it on a couple hikes too! It is very light weight, adjustable, and most importantly it does what i needed it to! I highly recommend OR to everyone in general, but if youre looking for rain or sun hat (or both) OR has you covered ( literally )!
review.name: Love this hat!

review.reviewBody:
I use this for trail running in freezing temperatures, for yard work when it's pouring and also for travelling. It's windproof, lightweight, I like the blue color, so what's not to like?

I cannot use for temperatures below -10C or below 15F where I use a warm wool hat, otherwise this is what I call a AWD hat (All Weather Design)
review.name: Lightweight, windproof, durable

review.reviewBody: This raincap is perfect.  It complements any hooded rainjacket and keeps rain out of my eyes, without getting soggy wet..
review.name: Great raincap

review.reviewBody: This is my "go-to" hat. Light, rainproof, durable. I replaced my last one due to a stitching flaw and was under warranty. OR proviced great customer service!
review.name: My go-to hat

review.reviewBody: rained first day of use and kept me dry. Bright shade of blue which seems to look good, albeit colorful, with almost everything. very very nice quality and rear adjustment strap was simple to use
review.name: great fit and look

review.reviewBody: Everything I've ever purchased from Outdoor Research has been first rate and this is, too. The gore-tex works perfectly and is both dry and breathable, the fit is excellent and the quality is obvious.
review.name: Outstanding quality, perfect fit

review.reviewBody: Light nice color and great to run errands in!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Keeps the rain off and looks good at the same time! I like that the wider brim doesn't let drips down my collar. Highly adjustable too.
review.name: Great weather protection

review.reviewBody: I work outside in all weather, so this hat is a big help to keep my head and glasses dry. I ordered the blue for my partner, and have had the yellow one for about a year now. Highly recommend!
review.name: great hat, keeps me dry all day!

review.reviewBody: For those who hike it, the AT is known as a wet trail.  Now that's a good thing when it comes to water being prevalent for drinking.  It also means you're likely to experience rain at some point and that's when this hat earns its keep.  It works fine in the sun as well.
review.name: Great on the AT

name: Seattle Rain Cap

review.reviewBody:
Ive now owned this Jacket for almost a year and living in the PNW gives me a unique opportunity to use shells 9 months out of the year in Temps that dont get below 30F. 

Sizing- Smaller then America Brands, Im 58 185lbs. Athletic build. Id preferred they left some space in the waist region for some of us DadBod guys so it isnt as tight when layering with a 800fill or higher Down jacket.  sleeve length is perfect with an arch shape on the ends to slip over your gloves.  The Main Zipper when Fully zipped the collar comes up just below the ear lobe without having the hood up.  I tested with a bicycle helmet and you cant fully zip the jacket and have a helmet on.  The Two Way zipper does make things convenient when needing to use restroom.  Two Pit Zips per side make things easy when you start overheating and gives you ample adjustment points.  The Chest Pockets are large and can fit a lot, but are designed for fishing in mind so you lose the pockets.  
 This is a 2.5L and the Inside liner I found doesnt do a good job releasing Vapor and I can feel the condensation build up when temps are between 48f degrees and warmer which is disappointing. 
 I use the Jacket as my daily jacket to the office or out on the town running errands, to me it is more of an Around the City Jacket, or while fly fishing, I would wear this hiking or cycling.
review.name: Good Alternative to Mainstream Brands

review.reviewBody:
This shell jacket is perfect for hiking, backpacking or fishing. Comparing to other Arc'teryx shell jackets I owned. I especially like the two big front pockets, generous soft material around the bottom of the hood. If you're looking for something alternative to the mainstream hard shell brands, I think you should look no further.

One thing to keep in mind is that this hood is not huge, likely can't accommodate climbing helmet.
review.name: Alternative to Arc'teryx jackets

name: Toned Trout 2.5L River Jacket

review.reviewBody: Ive been wearing this shoe for approximately 7 months climbing 2-3 times per week. Immediately it was very comfortable and fit like a glove. The fabric inside the shoe is softer than a lot of other shoes. Im able to wear this shoe for about 1.5 hours without much pain. My complaint about the shoe is that it has stretched out quite a bit within the last month or so. Even though it was pretty tight to begin with, its become about a half of a size too big. This makes it a lot harder to step on tiny holds or do heal hooks. Additionally, its not quite as stiff as I would like. As Ive worn them in, theyve become a lot less stiff. All that being said, I still love the shoe and would buy it again. I would recommend buying a super tight fit if you plan on climbing a lot because they will eventually stretch out.
review.name: Comfortable beginner shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought this so that I would have some space to cook, store equipment and get ready for the day in bad weather. Unfortunately because it just clips on at the top and bottom the wind gets in between the tent and vestibule and fills it with snow and rain making it useless. I would suggest some kind of zip on version or a storm flap with more clip points....would be could if you could zip out the mosquito net on the tent for when you don't need it to save some weight.. my advice to people if your going light and using a first light tent or I tent (they are great tents)  just go without the vestibule because if the weather is bad and you really need it ,it won't work anyway.
review.name: could be better

hasVariant.name: Torin 7 Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Torin 7 Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The shoes are great!! They made me want to go out & run more but sadly they get super dirty real quick( I knew they would get dirty since I got the white ones but I have to wash them weekly cause they get dirty so easily & quickly) & I have had them for less than 4 months & the sides of the soles are wearing down. I do not use them every day or anything like that but it's sad that they're giving me these small issues.
review.name: Great shoes but...

review.reviewBody: Wanted a new pair of Torin's as loved my Torin 5s. These fit very differently and don't seem to be breaking in. Will return
review.name: Not the same as previous Torin model 5

review.reviewBody: Was disappointed in this shoe! Loved my Altra trail running shoes especially for the zero drop and comfortability but I wanted a pair for road/walking adventures so I was directed to purchase these. After two weeks of wear I still had so much foot pain, it's way too tight on the sides but it was so loose around my ankle. If I had sized up it would be simply too big. No amount of breaking in was going to help the tightness. It also gave me weird hip pain too, which I've never experienced before, and it ceased once I stopped wearing the shoes. Had to return :/
review.name: Foot pain and disappointment

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes so much. I've been running in them for 4 weeks now and I have not a shin splint in sight! I typically always get shin splints and lower back pain with running. These Torins are an answered prayer!
review.name: Hello pain free running!!

review.reviewBody: I sized up 1/2 size from my usual size and found the promised land.
review.name: Great for road and treadmill runs

review.reviewBody: These are the worst of a series of bad Torin models. They hurt my feet and won't break in. They're narrow. The ankle is loose. The laces are too stretchy. I'm looking at other brands again.
review.name: Painful and narrow

review.reviewBody: I don't know who ultra thinks they're fooling, but I have gone through three pairs of Torin sneakers and have never had a problem, Until these!! The very comfortable toebox no longer exists my front toes on the outside at the top, where rubbing against the toebox and the cord at the top of the sneaker was cutting into my ankles. 20 minutes into a 40 minute workout. I had to take them off because they were killing my feet.!!
review.name: All I can say is UGH!! Altra what have you done?

review.reviewBody: Amazing shoe, but - 300km in 5 months and upper started having holes and detaching from sole on one shoe. I wear them only in dry weather, only for road running. Lone Peaks upper is indestructible.
review.name: Love them, except for the upper...

review.reviewBody: Sizing: I am normally a women's 10, in these I prefer a 10.5 Oftentimes, a 10.5 is not available, so I appreciate that half sizing. Also, if you're on your wide toe base journey, you know having a spacious toe box is part of the deal, so going up half a size sort of makes sense. I love these because they have a cushion, but a 0mm toe to heel drop. I am making my way towards a more barefoot lifestyle and these are perfect for that journey. I have had my current pair for a year and still wear them religiously- to work as a nurse, hiking, walking, practicing soccer, and to the gym for weight lifting. I also get compliments on this style of shoe. Love them!
review.name: Buying 2nd pair!

review.reviewBody: Run half size small, size up. Also the laces are way too short for those of us with wide feet. I am barely or not able to tie the shoes. Please make the laces at least 5" longer.
review.name: Great shoe except...

name: Torin 7 Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I got these in Banff during the film festival. As a bigger woman whos an avid hiker I have trouble finding technical clothing that fits. I had tried on Fjallraven pants years ago and nothing fit. I was jokingly trying these curved fit ones and WOW not only did the fit beautifully but they stretched in all the right places! My only wish was that I had more money so I could buy 2 pairs!
review.name: Unexpected joy

review.reviewBody: I bought these Keb Trousers as well as the Viddo Pro trousers and have kept them both! I love the extra leg and butt room compared to the normal sizing. I also cannot thank you enough for giving the short/tall option with the leg length. This extra feature in combination with the button options on the leg cuff, really allows me to customize the fit to my boots.
review.name: Great work and hiking pants, easy to customize

review.reviewBody: I love the quality and and they are the best. I just need one size up but you are sold out. I should have checked earlier. I am leaving to go hiking in New Zealand just happened to decide to buy them prior to my trip. Hoping to grab a pair when I return from Backcountry. I am an athletic 50 something but I do have a  menopausal tummy, I am working to reduce. They gave me a muffin top. I want room to tuck shirts into the waist and wear a belt a tiny bit larger will help. I normally wear womens 12 or 14.
review.name: they are great I just need a larger size

review.reviewBody: i bought 2 pairs a couple months ago on another website and they are amazing!!! They are so multi-purpose from canoe trips to long hikes. The vents in both the top and bottom parts of the pant are amazing. the pockets are so usefull the reenforced butt and knees are amazing the only thing i would change is i would make the croutch strechy due to the fact ive busted the open when flipping canoes.
review.name: Amazing quality!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for a trekking trip to Peru. They are now my favorite hiking/tracking pants.  They are so comfortable, the pockets are amazing. And the venting options made them comfortable in Various temperatures.  I am thinking about getting another pair.  I often have issues with the waist gapping but not even a little bit with the curvy fit.
review.name: Love love love

review.reviewBody: Absolutely the best hiking pants I've ever had. I was so hesitant to give them a try - they looked different than any others I have previously owned. These are the best fitting, well thought out pants I have ever purchased. Materials stretches in all the right places. They are flattering and functional. So far I have bought 3 colors. Great for travel -  I even dressed up the black version for a night on the town. Map-sized Pockets are easily accessed. Knees are roomy and allow movement in every direction. Front material is extra abrasion resistant. You will not regret it.
review.name: Literally the best hiking pants ever

review.reviewBody: Thank God fijallraven has started making long inseams for womens keb. Iam 5'11" with a 33" inseam, and women's were never long enough. I purchased men's, but they of course don't fit my hips right. I can finally purchase a pair of kebs that fit me, and of course as per usual fijallraven, quality is excellent. For reference, I am 5'11", 170lbs with a curvy to athletic build and the 40 fit perfectly.
review.name: Finally long enough

review.reviewBody: I bought the Keb Trousers Curved W pants about a month ago, and I'm very happy with this purchase. I really liked the original Keb Trousers, but always wanted a fit that was better for curvier women. These are the best fitting pair of pants I've ever had, hiking or otherwise. I wear them everyday to work, and I often get compliments. If you want a durable, well made hiking pant with a great fit and fun colors-- this is your choice!  Thank you Fjallraven.  I now own 3 pairs in this fit.
review.name: Love the Keb Trousers Curved W!!

review.reviewBody: I took one star off because sizing has changed. I purchased a 38 based on my first two pair of Keb curved purchased about 3-4 years ago. They are still great pants but now running larger than Keb curved from earlier versions. I would now require a 36. I had a 36 also about 3-4 years ago and they were much smaller. Also the upper side zip is now mesh, where as before there wasn't any mesh and unzipping would reveal skin. I kind of miss that. (not a fan of the mesh)..
review.name: Still great trousers but sizing/mesh has changed

review.reviewBody: Could finally buy these with the updated fit! Previously I hadn't liked how tight the leg was with no room in hips/butt area. Tried them on in my regular size & they fit BOTH my waist and thighs well. I'm 5'11, muscular, normally wear 30w pants, purchased a sz 10/euro 42. I'm happy to have these for the winter, I commute by bike in the northeast and these have been a great durable option. 32" inseam keeps ankles covered!
review.name: Improved curve fit is wonderful

name: Keb Curved Trouser - Women's

hasVariant.name: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
hasVariant.description: Buy the Optimus Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
review.reviewBody:
I have used this on hikes for lunch and it is easy to use.

When traveling, the top lid doesnt have anything to click or hold it into place so it is susceptible to moving around and not staying in place.  Also it is malleable so careful just putting it into your pack.

review.itemreviewed: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
review.reviewBody: Now that I have used this for my summer camping I can make a review. I Love this stove, very lite but a powerful flame that boils water fast. I have only used it to boil water but it does adjust to low  flame without going out.  Not one problem with it the whole summer. It's very easy to use, so a beginner to novice will enjoy it. It will pack up and all fit in the provided pot.
review.name: Good little kit

review.itemreviewed: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
review.reviewBody:
I have relied on a traditional, bomber MSR mountaineering stove forever...whether it's a legit winter mountaineering trip, or a simply overnight bike packing trip. 

I've finally reached a point where I realized I should just get a much smaller canister stove for shorter trips. Have always loved Katadyn's products so decided to give it a try. 

Super light, all packs together - canister, stand, two pots, along with the stove itself! Seems really well built and thought out. Looking forward to using this during the warmer months of the year.
review.name: Perfect size, weight, and portability!

review.itemreviewed: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
review.reviewBody: Lightweight, compact cook system. Would like an attached piezoelectric for starting.

review.itemreviewed: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
review.reviewBody: I have the HE version of this stove and fell in love with it. Decided to buy another for another daypack of mine. This comes with a windscreen (extremely useful), a stand, their lightweight stove (noncollapsible/nonfoldable). Very compact, packable stove. Boils water quick (would be quicker with Heat Exchange). Does what its designed for. No igniter, NEEDS a lighter or a sparker to light it. Great for indoor use as well (like a hotel).  Wish they had an actual lid not the pan, a flat 1 (help minimize footprint).
review.name: Great Stove

review.itemreviewed: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
review.reviewBody:
First time purchasing and using a portable stove for backpacking. Love the portability of this stove set, great for my use and situation, and able to pack in the set a small propane tank. The bag for the set is a nice add on.
The big pot and small pan work well for cooking and boiling water. Burner works well and easy to use. The wind guard works fine, wouldn't say it makes the biggest difference but nice to have. Overall, a great portable stove set for anyone to use, at a great price.
review.name: Great Portable Stove Set For Everyday Camping

review.itemreviewed: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
review.reviewBody: This has been my go to camp stove for about a year now and I love it. It lights easily, heats up quick, and seems relatively light (I don't have much experience carrying other stoves). Two downsides: 1. it has a few moving parts and one pot has a metal grill on the bottom, both of these things very much enhance the quality of the product however they are very hard to clean (without excessive amounts of water). I camp in desert-esque places and so I have started bringing an old toothbrush to clean at those hard to rinse places, I'm sure a quick dunk in a river would work fine. 2. This is not the most stable set-up, yes there are different size propane canisters and little stands for the bottom however with just the set and a canister that fits into the pot to store, without a pretty flat surface, it's a bit wobbly and has a tendency to end up in the dirt (accelerating problem number 1). This is nitpicky, and it really is a great stove.
review.name: Great stove (brush and flat rock not included)

review.itemreviewed: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
review.reviewBody: Great lightweight stove.  Quick to boil water at ~3 minutes.  Purchased for the Wonderland trail around Mt. Rainier.  Much smaller and lighter than my 2.5L Reactor.

review.itemreviewed: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
review.reviewBody: This stove kit has served me very well and I have no major complaints. There are a few things that could be improved. The fuel valve controller could use a redesign as it is finicky to work with and the stove cannot be screwed in with it closed, and it will also not close at 0%. It also conflicts with the windscreen sometimes and rotating it is not always easy. These are very minor things, but some similarly priced stoves do not have these issues. The arms that hold the pots are a little more flimsy than some others I have seen, but it makes up for it in btu and the pot system is excellent. Using both to boil water yields results comparable to jetboil (less than 2 minutes for boiling 2 cups of water) and they offer great versatility for on the go cooking as compared to some competitors. This packs down really well with the canister, stove, and sparker all fit compactly into the two pots and the mesh carrying case makes transporting the full kit very convenient. The sparker being separate is something I personally prefer as opposed to an integrated one as it is more versatile, more reliable and adds virtually no extra weight. Having used it in the snow and in wet conditions, the sparker being it's own unit adds more usability in a variety of conditions. The pots are excellent so far. Used them for around a year and a half and they still have their coating on the inside and still just as non-stick as it came. They are fairly light, and reasonably durable. The bigger pot did warp slightly when packed very tightly into my bag, but that is unlikely to happen when transporting it with a gas canister (which I was not) and I would chalk it up to me own error. Nevertheless it was very easy to bend back into a perfect circle so that the lid/pan fits.
review.name: Great simple do it all kit

review.itemreviewed: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
review.reviewBody: Used a few times and no issues. Boils water in seconds. No long-term use to give a real review.
review.name: Tested but not long term

name: Elektra FE Cook System - Black Edition
