hasVariant.name: Skyward II Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Skyward II Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These would be the best snowpants I owned if they just TRIED to be semi-waterproof. This is the start of my second season in these pants (because they were not cheap) and I might have to give in and buy a new pair. First day of the season it was snowing and I was drenched from riding the chairlift and skiing -- my backside was drenched through my thermals and the front area on the quads was soaked straight through. Then even the next day, not snowing, the butt was wet from sitting on the chairlift - it was cold, I assume the warmth of my body warming up the lift's chair pad was enough condensation. 

I wanted to love these. The stretch is unreal, I love the cut. I have plenty of room over my boots, borderline flair pants so not sure I agree with others on that. Love the power strap slots on the snow gaiter, absolutely genius. But come on OR, for a PNW company I thought these would deliver way more on waterproofing. 

Use areas: East coast skiing from early to late season. Powder and groomers. A few tours out west (ski and bootpack).
review.name: Not waterproof in the slightest

review.reviewBody:
Ive used these pants on a couple tours over the last couple weeks. Overall first impression is they are super comfy and the thigh pockets have a good amount of space. The hip pockets, however, are not very spacious. They mentioned a transceiver pocket which I think both thigh pockets would suffice, but there isnt a way to attach the device to prevent losing it. Already has a hole in the right thigh, potentially from a branch, had hoped they were more durable. 

Overall Ive liked these, just wish they were a tad more keen on the details and durability.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Like on older sleeping bags, when zippers could catch on nearby fabric and get totally jammed unable to move up or down, same thing happens on the upper pocket zippers on these pants. I see other reviews have noted similar, also verified with a friend who is sending his back for this same problem. Could be an issue with a particular production run, it has to do with the alignment of the fabric used for reinforcement of the zipper that is so wide that it pushes the pocket material toward the zipper track. 

Never have 2 hands free to get zipper unstuck when in the wild which is frustrating when you don't want to move items to other pockets. I have tried re-creasing the zipper reinforcement fabric to no avail, for now just using the lower pockets which don't seem to have the same issue. 
Should not happen on a premium OR product that supposedly was field tested. 
Certainly hope it's covered under warranty, am going to give it a few more trips to see if as the fabric softens the problem resolves.
review.name: Zippers get stuck on inner fabric

review.reviewBody: Thought they were amazing until they started to fall apart. One of the thigh pockets (the one I use) failed as well as the crotch which developed a hole pretty quickly. Love the fit, flexibility, breathability, and [reasonable] water resistance, but expect that a pair of technical pants with this price tag should hold up a little better.
review.name: Comfortable But Has Durability Issues

review.reviewBody:
Overall, these are great pants. I tried the various pants of this style at the backcountry store and landed on this one, which is between the super flexible pant and bombproof inflexible version. 

I?ve used them for skiing, backcountry/skinning, and ice climbing. They?re great for each of those applications in terms of flexibility and protection. Pockets and vents well placed. 

A problem is the zippers catch often. Especially the standard pant pockets. I swapped out one, and experience the same on the replacement. It?s a pain when wearing gloves and you need something.
review.name: Great pants, zipper issues

name: Skyward II Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Ooni Pizza Topping Station online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pizza Topping Station
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ooni Pizza Topping Station online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality and sturdy material. good. value for money too.
review.name: Brilliant piece of kit

review.reviewBody: Thought this would be great for our planned pizza parties. Removed from box to set up and noticed the seals fit poorly and pop out each time the lid is lifted - what a pain. In addition this is expensive and the quality does not match . It's ooni branded so they could have fixed manufacturing before selling. Don't waste your money! Ooni - if you have better fitting seals by all means send me some.
review.name: Poor Fitting Seals

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] really good present for someone who enjoys making pizzas!!
the seals on the lids can be a bit frustrating, but on the whole, its superb
review.name: Great Present!

review.reviewBody: Just do it, its not cheap but it adds to experience. It makes it easy to really get a nice flow for pizza making.
review.name: Great for Pizza Work Flow

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a must-have item for the Ooni! I bought my oven during the pandemic and have used it dozens of times. This topping station is a game changer!!! It is easy to use and clean and makes the cooking process so much easier!!!! Only wish I bought it sooner!
review.name: Wish I bought sooner!

review.reviewBody:
Very well made, easy to clean, would be even easier if it could go in the dish washer!
Annoying that the rubber seals fall out so easily
review.name: Ooni Pizza Topping Station

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was a total splurge Item I didn't need but it comes in handy when we are entertaining large parties and I need to make Pizza's fast. I am glad I bought it.
review.name: Total Splurge but worth it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The rubber seals pop off every time I take the covers of and they are impossible to get back on. It seems like they dont fit correct. This is the first item from OOni that hasnt been fantastic
review.name: The rubber seals pop off

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Vraiment pratique et il est trs bien fini , cest du bon matriel .
review.name: Vraiment pratique et il est

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If youre having a pizza party and offering multiple topping choices this is a really nice accessory to have. If youre only making one or two pizzas, its a bit over the top. Really nicely made.
review.name: For certain occasions

name: Pizza Topping Station

description: Buy the The North Face Berkeley 16L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Berkeley 16L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Berkeley 16L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect for carrying my Nintendo Switch and extra controller.
review.name: Great gaming bag.

review.reviewBody: Great for daily use. I pack there my ipad and laptop plus a couple of books and it's great.
review.name: Great for daily use.

review.reviewBody: Perfect for my daily commute to work! I needed a bag smaller than my Recon, but large enough to fit a 13" macbook, daily needs (headphones, wallet, etc), and space for a water bottle. There is a padded laptop compartment, and a big open space (with some organization pockets), in addition to the front zippered pocket for small items. Two side slide-in pockets-I was worried the pockets would be too small to fit a water bottle,, but it fits a 24oz camelbak without an issue. Would love to see The North Face carry this in more colors!
review.name: Love this bag, great for daily office commute and travel

review.reviewBody: Well made, great option for wanting something to easily care a wide variety of items. Wallet, glasses, books, etc..
review.name: Fun & functional!

review.reviewBody: The Berkeley Daypack is a great little bag. It's lightweight and compact, which makes it perfect for class or quick trips around town. It's advertised to fit a 16-inch laptop, but my HP Omen Transcend doesn't fit in the designated laptop compartment, only in the main pouch. That's a bit of a bummer, but overall, it's still a nice pack for carrying my laptop, chargers and notebook without being too bulky.
review.name: Berkeley Daypack's a Solid Choice

review.reviewBody: Perfect for school, holds everything I need for my day! Made with quality materials and super durable
review.name: I love my new backpack

review.reviewBody: I chose this backpack to use for my laptop and somethings for school and it very cute! I have been able to carry what I need with no issues!
review.name: Very cute and durable!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this bag. Super comfortable and has been my bag of choice during work and for school! I walk about ~15000 steps on my busiest work/schools days and I am comfortable! The straps are really what sold me.
review.name: 15,000 steps a day? No prob!

review.reviewBody: The Berkeley Daypack is well-made with beautiful fabric. Used for travel, it easily holds my laptop, iPad and other items. It's just the right size so I don't overpack because t's important to make the journey enjoyable. Last trip, it got soiled from the dirty bins at the airport security check point. When I got home, I unzipped all pockets, placed it in a large mesh laundry bag, machine-washed with the usual laundry soap on a cold water cycle, then hung up and let it air dry. All smudges came out and it looked like new! I also purchased the Berkeley field bag to use as a purse. It's a great size and has 3 zippered sections, the back one is hidden to hold valuables. Since airlines allow only 1 carry-on and 1 personal item, the field bag easily into the main section of the Berkeley daypack -- I didn't worry about my purse being unsecured or getting lost in the overhead storage bin.
review.name: Great Purchase!

review.reviewBody: I use this backpack everyday for college and I love it!! It's super comfy and has plenty of space for my school supplies.
review.name: Such a GREAT product!

name: Berkeley 16L Daypack

description: Buy the Cotopaxi Cada Dia Todo 2L Hip Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cada Dia Todo 2L Hip Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Cada Dia Todo 2L Hip Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Gifted this to my 18 year old brother for Christmas, he loves it! Very classic and functional style, fits his wallet, phone, keys, passport, and snacks with ease. Will be taking it on our trip to Puerto Rico! Super well made and durable material.
review.name: Perfect travel belt bag!

review.reviewBody: I love the color/design of this bag, but it doesnt have the capacity to fit anything additional to the essentials for everyday wear (keys, phone, wallet).
review.name: A little too compact

review.reviewBody: This bag holds all daily essentials and can be concealed under a jacket. It can be worn at the hip for less bulk above or cross shoulder for easy access and protection
review.name: Great pack for travel

review.reviewBody: This is nice but the size does not feel like the other 2L Hip pack i bought.
review.name: Nice but small

review.reviewBody: Love the color. Fits all my daily necessities and comfortable, has good space and compartments even being at a smaller size. Also it's not big and heavy, doesn't feel like I am carrying much but still has good amount of space for daily stuffs like wallet, keys, AirPods, and many other stuffs.
review.name: Good everyday pack, comfortable, and spacious.

review.reviewBody: This perfect little bag is a great companion for day hikes, a quick bike ride, or a trip to the grocery store. The bright purple is fantastic as well.
review.name: LOVE!

review.reviewBody: I love this hip/shoulder pack. Perfect size for daily necessities to run errands, hanging out or taking a hike. I added some durable carabiners to have water bottle and or umbrella depending on what Im doing. Good quality. Holds quite a bit minus my phone because I like to keep that in my pocket.
review.name: Mine is in black

review.reviewBody: Well made and just the right size for a daypack for me. Good for city trips.
review.name: Great crossbody bag!

review.reviewBody:
This bag has everything I have been searching for the past 4 years - wide strap for comfort and weight distribution when well loaded, 2L with multiple zip pockets, nice color, water resistant fabric

I have 4 different hip packs I cycle between and since getting this one it has become my daily. I can fit a wallet, 2 cells phones, mass of keys, and whatever else I need in it. When not heavily packed, I can even get my kindle in there with my wallet and phone. The Allpa X 1. 5L was never comfortable to me because of the thinner strap and I could never understand the front pocket on the Coso, so I was super excited to see Todo 2L release. I am on the shorter side, and this pack doesn't seem too large for my frame to wear crossbody. Love the extra organization pockets inside the main pocket as well!
review.name: Finally, a belt bag that is the perfect for everyday.

review.reviewBody: On the small side but will be good for quick trips.
review.name: On the small side but

name: Cada Dia Todo 2L Hip Pack

description: Buy the Smith Parallel Max 2 Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Parallel Max 2 Polarized Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Parallel Max 2 Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The Parallel Max is all Ive worn since they first came out. I love them!
review.name: The Parallel Max is all

review.reviewBody: Great fit and appearance! Super for sunny ski days!
review.name: Great fit and appearance! Super

review.reviewBody: Excellent, everything looks crisp and brighter while still providing great coverage from the sun! This is my second pair!
review.name: Excellent, everything looks crisp and

review.reviewBody: Nice clear lenses with wide range of vision. Love that you can buy multiple lenses for different light conditions and activities. The lenses seem to be a light touch to come out of their socket but I havent had any mishaps yet.
review.name: Versatile Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: So love those glasses. But you better do not need to chnage lenses quickly. It will take patience and a LOT of time
review.name: Love teh glasses. Interchanging the lenses is challenging

review.reviewBody: Fits great, looks great. I just wish people wouldnt lose them when they borrow them.
review.name: Fits great, looks great. I

review.reviewBody: Very nice, but less robust than Parallel Max 1s, seems to have been a cost reduction activity to almost mimic the original. Tha lenses are not held in as securely as in MAX 1s.
review.name: Very nice, but less robust

review.reviewBody: Great fit and so light you forget you have them on
review.name: Great fit and so light

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable glasses. This is my second pair of Parallel Max glasses, since the last one's were lost. Unfortunately, Smith only includes 2 sets of lenses instead of 3 (like the olden days) forcing me to purchase the additional color that I needed. I use them for mountain biking, so I need a variety of lense colors for the light conditions.
review.name: Great glasses

review.reviewBody:
These replace my previous Parallel glasses that replaced their predecessor. These are the perfect balance of protection and weight for me. The optics are crystal clear and I can wear them for long periods of time outdoors. They are just as at home in the car as they are golfing or fishing or at a vacation resort. The brown lenses are my favorite balance between bright clarity and sun glare reduction. I highly recommend them. 

I should note this is the second warranty replacement pair in over 10 years. Smith customer service is unbeatable. The quality was very good. I just wore them until they came apart. Which is more than I can say for some of my other glasses that just failed.
review.name: My Everything Sunglasses

name: Parallel Max 2 Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I just got this pfd and wore it for a 5-day kayak trip in Maine.  It was very comfortable and the pockets held my vhs radio and assorted gear very easily with room to spare.

review.reviewBody: Great design, great fit, super versatile.  I can fit a tasty beverage in the front left stretchy pocket (this is a huge plus!)
review.name: Great for canoeing

review.reviewBody: Great vest, lightweight and stylish. Perfect for fishing.
review.name: E-ronny fishing vest review

review.reviewBody: Just enough storage without getting in the way while paddling or hauling bags. The large pocket fits my mid-sized iPhone with case and the smaller one takes random items I might need on me. The thin back makes shouldering a pack easy but is less than ideal when using a seat with a back. Great overall fit and adjustability without too many extra straps in the way.
review.name: Solid option for canoe tripping

review.reviewBody: XL was small for somebody who typically wears extra large headgear. Tight enough that it was almost uncomfortable, but could have dealt with it. Pads probably would have broken in a bit and compressed after some wearing. However, it skated around my head in a way you dont want this type of helmet to do. Has a weird fabric liner that seems to cause this. Does not come with any extra pads to custom fit. Ultimately helmet did not make me feel that it would provide the proper protection in a hard downhill crash. Returned.
review.name: Strange helmet

review.reviewBody:
Cool helmet, fit is somewhat small. Ultra flimsy visor bolts that were all snapped on arrival. 

(edit: bought a replacement! Which also arrived with... snapped visor bolts.)
review.name: Seems neat, visor bolts snapped
comment: Exact same thing happened here. Bolts snapped off and floating in the box.
Same!  Just received mine and the visor was broken off in the box (box and overpack looked fine.)

description: Buy the POC Elicit Toric Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Elicit Toric Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Elicit Toric Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have prescription glasses and I've been trying to find some riding glasses without any visible frame so I can have an unobstructed view of down the road. The POC Elicit Torics are frameless so I have full view top bottom, left and right. My prescription is for reading, middle distance, and long distance. Without my glasses, my medium and long distance sight is manageable, but I can't read my Garmin without them. So, I purchased some Hydrotac Stick-on readers and applied them to the lower part of the Elicit Torics and they work great! I can read my Garmin! I highly recommend the Elict Torcs for anyone who's looking for a huge unobstructed view and anyone who wants to turn them into readers. Handy feature is they come with different length nosepieces so you can adjust how far down on your face they fit.
review.name: Huge Unobstructed View

name: Elicit Toric Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: Little big if you have smaller calves or are taller, but they work well. Never had a problem of them falling, etc.
review.name: Much better than previous versions.

review.reviewBody: very comfortable. Used them with my wool socks and combination worked like a charm.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Amazing; the best gravel guard around. No sand, rocks, or coral will get in these. 

I went a half size up in flats sneakers to fit them nicely.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Perfect for white fishing in the summer time until hunting in the early season recommend them socks in the wading boots

This is a big functional improvement over previous styles.  Allows you to roll down the gravel guard component while they sock remains high and snug enough to prevent gravel from getting in between your shin and the guard.
review.name: Great Design

review.reviewBody: Love these wet wading socks cus they fit nicely on my feet but more importantly in my boot . Always wore a cheapo pair of neoprene sock that was too big and very uncomfortable in my boots . So glad I finally decided to get these Simms wading socks cus they are that great .. The gravel guards with the hook help keep small rocks out of my boots huge bonus .. Cant go wrong
review.name: Love these wet wading socks

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, nice lightweight material. Would recommend
review.name: Great pair of socks

review.reviewBody: Ive been through a lot of wading socks as we primarily wet wade in New Zealand.  The built in gravel guard fits great over my boots.  The soft lining keeps my feet comfortable on the long walk back.
review.name: Best Ive found.

review.reviewBody: I love the thickness and the fit on my foot. I have skinny legs and so they are not tight around my ankle and calf. I have yet to use them in the water but o think I will be exchanging them.

Best socks Simms has made so far. On the Texas Coast we wade a lot of sandy mud soft bottom with grass and the mud, sand, and small shells mixed in the bottom would have a tendency to get inside the previous guide wet wading socks. Not with the Flyweight socks. The extension above the gravel guard is a huge help, Ive used them for 3 weeks now and still no silt, sand, mud or shells in my socks. Simms for the win, always.
review.name: BEST WET WADING SOCK FOR TEXAS

name: Flyweight Neoprene Wet Wading Sock

review.reviewBody:
I selected the Keen Zionic because I wanted a casual outdoor shoe for the wet PNW fall/winter season.  I typically wear an 8.5 to a 9.  I went with the 9 and its like wearing a clown shoe  I feel like Im going to trip over my toes with every step.  To keep the heel from slipping I would normally lace the shoes using the extra eyelet at the top, but the shoes are built up so high they dig into the top of my foot and are very painful.  Also, the laces are too short to accommodate bunny-ear lacing.  Even with normal lacing there is something that pinches painfully at the upper inner part of my foot when I walk.  Im still investigating the cause but it might be the tongue that is awkwardly folded together and attached at the sides.

Despite the fact these shoes obviously do not fit me well, they seem to be well-made and are sturdy and attractive.  I would return them but Ive worn them outdoors three times trying to break them in.
review.name: Sturdy but painful

review.reviewBody: Only worn once so far, but very happy with it. LOVE the orage!!
review.name: Very Comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So comfortable and so supportive and so waterproof
review.name: I love these shoes so much!

review.reviewBody: Bad quality looks like used for long time after 1 used
review.name: Women zionic

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have worn Keen shoes for decades. Glad they offer new styles to attract new wearers but I can no longer purchase shoes without first trying them on.
That said these looked nice but we're too narrow in the toe area for me. I did find another style of Keen that worked for me though.
review.name: Narrow toe box

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable, and absolutely true to size. I'm always a little hesitant to purchase new brands without trying on a pair, but everything I heard about Keens pushed me right over the edge of my hesitancy! The only reason I've got a star off is they're giving me the absolute gnarliest blisters on right where my calves start heading to ankle territory. I totally get that it's because of the material, and that it's historically not a spot that super stiff, hard material normally comes into contact with.
review.name: A dream with one caveat.

review.reviewBody:
Ive been searching for shoes that fit my narrow heel, wide forefoot feet all summer. These fit the bill and Im so relieved! The heel feels very secure but the top of the heel is quite rigid and rubs. I bent this piece of fabric a little and it helped take some of the friction off.

The only thing I am not as pleased about is that theyre quite warm, even sitting in an air conditioned home. I will be exchanging for the non waterproof version to see if it helps.
review.name: Great fit and support!

review.reviewBody: These are great shoes. They're comfortable, supportive and tough enough for hiking on trails. The fit is wide enough but no too wide. Plus they look nice.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: Feels pretty good so far. No breaking in needed. Only complaint is outside left shoe sole is a bit wider than right shoe.
review.name: Feels pretty good so far.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These hiking shoes are comfortable and offer good padding however the material feels a little stiff. Not a fan of this blue and pink combo color, difficult to match clothes.  I would prefer it in another color.  These shoes also feel a little heavyweight. The bottom soles have good structure and are thick which provide good grip for hiking.
review.name: Good

name: Zionic WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Im a local truck driver, and the size is perfect doesnt take a lot of room inside the cab and fits everything I need for a 12 hr day, love the reflective material it has on the sides, I go to work  when its still dark
review.name: Coleman Pro 16 can

review.reviewBody: If you forget to close top zipper and open the lid everything falls out the dry storage part. Wish it had side or pockets for keys and my can of chew. The lid will make the cool fall over when you open it if you have to much stuff in the top storage area and not much weight in the cooler.
review.name: Soft cooler 16
comment:
Hello! Thank you for sharing your experience with our Coleman _Pro Soft Cooler. I'm sorry to hear that the product did not live up to your expectations due to a design flaw in the cooler. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. We always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department.

For further queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose contact us from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

Thank you very much, and have a wonderful day!

review.reviewBody: I've used it about a month now and it's been great perfect size, and the top is very nice for keeping my odds and ends in!
review.name: Perfect size lunch cooler

review.reviewBody: I bought this cooler to replace my Milwaukee lunch cooler for work. The insulations is more thicker and the out side is easier to clean and maintain. It does have lot of glue together seams on the side and bottom hopefully it will last longer then my old one. It keep things cooled but you need a good quality ice pack to put in there with your things. Pocket on top to keep things dry is a good design I store my dry snacks and personal item in it stays dry all day. I would recommend and buy this or the next model that they make.
review.name: Awesome lunch cooler

review.reviewBody: Works fantastic, keeps everything cool and works great.
review.name: Best lunchbox Ive had so far.

review.reviewBody: The build quality and cold retention is fantastic. The only downside is that I would not call this a 16 can cooler. Its more of a 12 can once you add ice or cold packs. The dry storage area on top is convenient.
review.name: Great quality, smaller capacity than advertised.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great cooler to use for weekend outings. I recently used it for a weekend trip. We were going to stay in a hotel, and we are always so thirty for water. Once we get to the hotel, the water is always so expensive, so I saw this as an opportunity to try out the cooler. I packed it to the brim with water bottles. I took them at room temperature for the ride. At the hotel, I put them in the refrigerator to get cold. When we would go on our outings, I would place the cold water bottles in the cooler, and it would keep them cold all day. This was a great cooler!
review.name: Cooler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Coleman Pro Soft 16 can cooler is really awesome. Coleman is my go to brand for coolers and this handy soft sided cooler did not disappoint. Its great to carry your lunch in but also big enough to hold drinks for outings. I definitely recommend it.
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm loving my new Coleman cooler, it's great insulation, very cool style, it has enough space and it's great for picnics, camping and more. It holds ice well and keep all drinks cold even for more than a whole day. The shoulder straps are comfortable. Will always be part of the reunions or get togethers away from home!
review.name: Pretty Good insulation

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this pro soft Coleman 16 can cooler.I love how easy it is to load our drinks into the cooler with out no problem.its very soft and I love how wide the strap is that goes onto your arm while carrying your Coleman pro soft cooler.I highly recommend this product
review.name: Coleman Cooler

name: Pro Soft Cooler 16-Can

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Absolute Zero Down Suit - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I wear this suit working as a mountain guide on 8000m peaks. Up there youre going to want something durable and warm. Its your safety suit. This one provides an unparalleled level in both.
review.name: Best Suit on Everest

review.reviewBody: I'm not a mountain climber but I sometimes have to sit in a cold environment for extended periods.  This suit is everything I expected.  Its very warm, the baffles leave zero cold spots.  The hood allows for any adjustments you could need.  The details including zippers, pockets, and materials are all top notch.  I expect many years of reliable warmth, as I've come to expect from Mountain Hardwear.
review.name: Warmth without compromise!

review.reviewBody: I bought one last year and I have worn it a few times.  Its lighter in weight than the Northface bee suit. Its an attractive, visible color scheme against the snow, its very, very warm and has ample packets but it runs way bigger than the measurements guide and looks very bulky and almost sloppy.  I had to belt mine.  The too long legs can be stuffed into boots, but the legs are really bulky too. I'm a true medium and this medium suit ran really large.  I had to belt it, sleeves and legs too long, fit in the shoulders, huge everywhere else.The quality is spectacular.  Its really nice they are now offering a woman's fit option this year. Other companies do not do that.
review.name: Alaska Worthy

review.reviewBody: fits perfectly, well made and looks really warm for those upcoming 8000m climb.
review.name: fits like a glove

review.reviewBody: I found this to be ample warm in the coldest conditions.  the hood is well stuffed with prime goose down and wraps around the mouth and chin
review.name: excellent warmth internal suspenders assure good fit

review.reviewBody: I hope those are not columbia mountaineering boots the model is wearing!!!
review.name: Mountaineering shoes

description: Buy the Stoic Bell Tent: 6-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bell Tent: 6-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stoic Bell Tent: 6-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It's big. It's heavy. It's awesome. There's lots of space. The quality is very good for the price. We have used it twice, including one day of heavy rain. The inside stayed very dry.  It's great to be able to stand up and have plenty of room for the kiddos to play a little indoors if the weather is poor for outdoor activities. A relatively larger area than the footprint and good staking conditions OR well placed trees for tie out are required for a good setup, but we haven't had a problem so far.
review.name: Awesome car camping/ long stay tent

review.reviewBody:
We have had a pop up camper the last 4 years. 2 days before our camping trip we opened it up and found that it had been leaking and had water damage. Long story short we have a 1 1/2 year old child and still were wanting to go camping but we needed the space as well as a tent that wasnt thin and cheaply made. This tent checked all our boxes off. From the 
Thick canvas to the
big tent pols that were actually metal not cheap fiberglass ones
To the size of it inside when its set up. To how quickly we could set it up. It takes about 5 to 10 mins of easy set up.

Long story short we are having our pop up camper repaired and we have decided to sell it since we got this tent. 

It is not a light thin tent its actually a thick one that wont rip and be trash at the end of the summer when youre camping with your family. Our dogs had space inside as well.

Its a fantastic family tent and should definitely be marketed towards that side of the market. Its literally the best family tent we have ever had.
review.name: The best quality family tent!!!!!

review.reviewBody:
Bought this a while back for some trips this summer, downfall was the lack of reviews.  Used this past weekend and wanted to help others.  Set up very easy with only  few directions needed.  First time took maybe 15 minutes.  Very large, slept 4 of us on 2 full size pads and a large dog kennel and all of our clothing bags.  Plenty of walking room still available.  We had wind and rain over the 3 days and there wasn't any leaking, and I didn't do anything extra to the seams.  Wind ranged somewhere in the 20-50 mph range off and on through the nights.  Tent held steady with minimal movement, all from the side taking the brunt of the force.  Center pole barely moved at all, but never a concern with it falling.  Inside stayed warm with temps in the upper 40's.  Another 3 season tent was set up nearby that wasn't able to stay in use due to the wind.  Luckily they brought a camper as well.

Overall very happy with this purchase!  Only thing I wish it really had was another opening or pole set up on the opposite side.  Door opening creates a lot more room on that side, but due to how big the tent is it isn't necessary.  I would definitely buy this again.
review.name: Great Family Option

review.reviewBody: Pleased with how quick and easy it is to setup after watching a YouTube best practice video. Everything from the tent material to the pole to the tie down ropes to the flooring feels of good quality materials. Lighter than canvas (though still fairly heavy overall) and less maintenance/hassle for when it gets wet or dirty. Haven't experienced a rainstorm yet, but seams are all taped so I imagine we'll be just fine. My family loves how spacious it is inside and the number of windows it has, which I anticipate will help with ventilation. Big enough inside we setup a movie projector inside and used a wall as the screen. The center pole has a couple metal rings to hang a light or fan from, and there's a few storage pockets around inside near the bottom wall. All in all we are thrilled with this tent.
review.name: Loving it

name: Bell Tent: 6-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody:
Id definitely recommend working with Backcountry vs. Lake if you want a pair of Lake shoes. The company doesnt have online ordering down nor have they figured out customer service. 

Now onto the shoe. Its quite comfortable. Plenty of room up front without having my foot swimming around. Good stiffness and walking is just fine. BUT-no matter how tight I get it, my heel slips out. A lot. I know what youre thinking: too big. Thatd be my first thought reading this; however, they are pretty snug. Much more so that the two Specialized pairs these replaced. Also, the shoe keeps sucking the tongue down as Im riding. I have to stop ever 15 minutes to pull them back out. This even though I keep tightening them down to the point of being uncomfortable. A final note about the Boa system. Ive never been a fan. Maybe someone has a suggestion on how to fix this. When I pop the dial up, I cant get the cable spooled out far enough to pull my foot out easily. On the flip side, all the tugging, yanking and expletives doesnt help me get them tight enough off the bat. I have to ride for a while and keep reaching down to twist them a few clicks the first few miles before theyre snug. I suppose the double Boa shoes wouldve solved some/all of this. I just didnt want leather shoes and the pair with double Boas were made with leather. Ill be ditching these soon for a different pair.
review.name: Okay shoe. Lots of heel slippage.

review.reviewBody: I have wide feet and the Lake MX 219 wide shoes resolved the foot pain I would get on longer rides (greater than 30 miles). I added cleats and had a proper cleat fitting session with a pro fitter.  The pain has gone and I really love the shoes for that alone. The BOA tensioner is smooth easy to cinch up or release. Comfortable walking around on the shoes but dont plan any long hikes in them. Ive ridden about 300 miles in the shoes so far.
review.name: Relief for my toes

review.reviewBody: I bought a set of road bike shoes liked them so much I bought a set of Mtn. bike shoes.  Great fit !
review.name: Best cycling shoes I have had

review.reviewBody:
Ive battled pressure and painful and numb toes for years. Measured my feet per Lakes guidelines and viola!  The width in the toe box solved my problem. In that regard Im very happy with the shoes. 

The not so great, but livable. Single BOA makes even and consistent security a bit fiddly. The BOA cords also catch and hang on the edges of the material on the tongue. Ive learned to fasten the BOA with my finger under the cords to help guide it and to tighten the lower part of the shoe. Remove my finger after I pull the looseness out of the forefoot and tighten the rest. A big deal? No. But my shoes still loosen after a bit of riding. 

The sole. As you can see in the photos the sole under the heel flares out. That extra width in combination of the seat stay width of a boost axle makes a tight clearance even more so. I get a lot of rubbing and Ive never had an issue before. Fortunately I had frame protection already installed. The more curved shoe last may also contribute to a more inward heel?

Am I unsatisfied? No. But I should have moved up to the dual BOA shoe. The quality of material and construction is there for a $240 shoe. But I would like a few things tweaked to call this shoe terrific.
review.name: Terrific fit, so so exec

name: MX219 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
These are the best gravel tires hands down. Smooth on the road and awesome in the dirt!
Pretty quick delivery too.
review.name: Best tires!

review.reviewBody: I have only put a few hundred miles on so far this spring. They roll fast on tarmac but shine on the gravel. First ride was Oracle to Mt Lemmon, Az . I was inflated to the max and had numerous leaks on the bead. My ride was quite bouncy at 60psi. I also have Cush Core inserts. After several weeks I dont lose much pressure and am back to riding my glacial moraine playground back in Wyoming. So far so good, but this review will probably jinx me.. that said, I have no issues on traction ..
review.name: Great tyres so far

review.reviewBody:
Compared to the Teravail Cannonball which I rode before, the Cinturato Gravel M has a bit more grip on gravel and the loose stuff, and a bit more rolling resistance. The difference is not as big as I expected though - I would say that the Cinturato looks more aggressive than it really is.

The good - the compound is grippy, it went on pretty easily, and it's a decent all around tire. If you want to go mainly on paved roads and smooth gravel, it's probably a bit too rough. Conversely, if your primary target is singletrack, then you may want something with a bit more bite.

No opinions on wet grip since I haven't tried it.

The bad - it went on easily and popped on the rim right away, but it did not seal properly until I pumped it up to 80 psi and left it like that overnight. After that it was fine.

I got the tan wall which looks cool, but it's a pretty dark brown compared to other tan wall tires. So if you want something with a light color that really "pops", this may not be for you.
review.name: Decent tire for rougher roads

review.reviewBody:
I rode a set over the winter when I spend less time on Tarmac and more on Western North Carolina fire roads.  The tread is excellent for rooty rocky terrain, zero complaints there.  

The 2-star deduction is for the sidewall tear I got on a gravel downhill section.  Instant deflation of the front tire, heart in my throat moment.  The tear was from a piece of gravel; it wasn't glass or metal or anything like that.  I don't like having second thoughts descending at speed, so I switched to a different tire after that.
review.name: Great Tread Pattern for rough terrain

review.reviewBody:
UPDATE: Still loving this tire after a few thousand miles. Supremely confident on rougher gravel, at least in terms of durability. I am of course running them tubeless with sealant just in case but to my knowledge have not had even a tiny puncture even as the center knobs are starting to wear thinner. Still tend to air them up to 35 psi but at that pressure they are pretty hard/firm on gravel and could come down 5 psi.

Easy to mount. I have swapped them back and forth several times between Zipp 303s (hookless) and Stans wheel sets (700c) without a problem.

Original Review: This tire looks nice and is more aggressive than the average gravel tire. The side knobs are good for cornering on dirt but not so ideal for cornering on street. My intent for this tire is mainly off-road, for which I find <35psi to be best. When I have to take them on-road, 45psi+ feels pretty solid. In at least the 40mm width I do notice the extra rolling weight when trying to accelerate. These were very easy to mount and seat with a canister-type floor pump.
review.name: Nice-looking, aggressive tire

review.reviewBody:
UPDATE JUNE 27, 2021 (350 miles) -- am in love with this tire and count it among the very best all rounders I have ever ridden on any surface.   these rank up there with my love for IRC Mythos and Panaracer Dart/Smoke from my MTB Racing days 35 years ago.   they are just a capable, predictable, and just a very solid performer.  with ZERO punctures!   can be a bit slippery in rain and  deep mud puddles, but this tire clings to chunky mud very well, and has not washed out in sand, even at high pressure.    if only these came in a 50mm.

May 2021 -
got these in 700x45 for my Bombtrack Hook to be more road worthy but still maintain off road beast mode.  having removed too large Vittoria Barzo's in 29 x 2.1, these skinny tires have a lot to live up to.  while I did not traverse deep mud well, they sleighed gravel, dirt, and tall grass, while being among the stickiest on blacktop/pavement that I have ever ridden. 

by far these were the easiest tubeless set up I have ever attempted in 6 years being a rider of tubeless tires.   I don't understand how anyone has issues getting these on rims.  for me (57yo lady) they seated immediately to Shimano GRX wheels, got bathed in Stans by shaking tires parallel to floor, then aired up (at higher pressure at first to allow better seating and coverage - pro tip from a mech) and have held prefect alignment to rim.

they will likely stretch a bit wider as they break in, but if not, the bike handles so much better with the more narrow width.   the dark brown side wall looks exceptional in person, but not all bikes will be as handsome or match.  will update once I have more miles and can speak to durability.    both tires had seams visible on the sidewall through the casing but hoping that's how they're supposed to look.

i would not hesitate to put these on  any gravel or road bike with the clearance to try adventure rides.
review.name: Sticky on Pavement & Dirt/Mud

review.reviewBody: I couldn't begin to get these tires on the rim. It's almost as if they were 650's marked as 700's. Couldn't even get the first bead around the wheel. The tire levers were ten inches apart and not going anywhere. I have Pirelli P Zero tires on my road bike and they fit fine. I wanted this tread for gravel and was truly disappointed when they wouldn't mount. And I paid for overnight shipping because one of the WTB tires that came with my bike was defective and blew before I got one mile down the road. Wound up with the Maxxis Rambler which is working out quite well. Easy to install and have taken quite a beating.
review.name: Disappointment

name: Cinturato GRAVEL M Tubeless Tire

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Pros: immediate and long-term comfort, ankle support, solid tread, stylish Cons: not even water resistant, soaks quickly in the lightest moisture, sole and upper falling apart in less than one year of moderate use I love these shoes but in limited settings. Not as durable or waterproof as I'd want in a shoe like this.
review.name: Good for dry or mud climates, bad for wet climates

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots in so many ways (fit, toe box, comfort, weight) but have been very disappointed with its durability. After about 200 miles of backpacking, they cracked and crumbled on the outside. The inside of the shoes still looks like new and the soles have some wear but are in good shape but the outside on both shoes split open (where you bend your foot to go uphill/downhill) and I had to use duck tape and super glue on my last trip to keep them together.
review.name: Great hiking boot but disappointed with durability

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are my go to shows for morning trail runs and longer hikes. No break-in required! Perfect, as always, right out of the box!
review.name: Perfect right out of the box

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these but due to their NOT being at all waterproof this caused many problems. I work outdoors and due to high humidity the morning dew on the grass causes dampness and this literally seeps in the shoe causing wetness all day and STINK. The interior of the shoe and my socks are literally wet all day long. I'm not walking through puddles. It's literally from the dew on the grass. Not a win. Trying out the timp to see how it does but liked the roominess and lack of stiffness of the shoe. Pretty comfortable as well but I cannot wear them. Worth noting I understand why someone said they trip. It's due to the lace hooks catching and that's pretty dangerous. Hope Altra upgrades and gets a better quality replacement. They also don't hold up too well. This is after a month of wear, so 20-30 days.
review.name: Super disappointed wanted to love

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am blown away by these hiking shoes. I have used Altras since my first thru hike on the Colorado Trail. I bought this pair for trekking in Iceland, and they are AMAZING. They have great tread, they are still super light, I really like the ankle support, and they kept my feet DRY and WARM. I forded rivers, hiked through melting snow fields, mud, etc. These shoes are worth it.
review.name: BUY these shoes!!

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are comfortable, lightweight and roomy. But, they are not water resistant: my feet are humid after a short walk on wet grass. Disappointing. And they're kind of noisy... because if the upper material. But that I wouldn't bother much!
review.name: Not waterproof, not truly water resistant either!

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've previously bought Altra Lone Peaks a couple years ago. These don't feel as nice. The rub a little on the back. They feel a little narrower. I don't remember having to break in the previous pair.
review.name: Lower quality & narrower

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I do love these shoes, my podiatrist recommended them for the wide toebox and ankle stability, but three times the lace from one shoe has gotten caught in a hook from the other shoe and twice caused me to fall. I wasn't even on a trail, just walking on flat even surface. Glad I wasn't on the stairs! When it happened last week, I came home and squashed all four down with the pliers so they won't catch anymore, but so the laces can still be threaded through. Definitely a design flaw. They should come with a warning before someone gets seriously hurt. It happens so fast! I see someone else also posted this issue. One other thing, I love the blue laces, but they're way too long. I've been triple tying them.
review.name: Love the shoe, but open hooks cause falls

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: As an owner of the previous model Women's Lone Peak All-Weather Mids, I loved the roomy toe box and high ankle support. Completely disappointed in the newest model's significantly narrower fit. The body of the shoe is still great, but the toe box has gone from extra wide to far too narrow. Feels like they messed with the fit simply for the sake of it while ignoring the actual needs for use as a hiking shoe. Suggest anyone with bunions or other toe issues continue to look elsewhere or try to find the original fit somewhere.
review.name: New model is a disappointing downgrade

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shoes allow my feet to bend and move properly. Not stiff and ungiving. Only issue I have is that they make my feet really hot, and its only the start of May. I wish they would breathe a bit like the other shoes. Other than that I find these to be a really good shoe.
review.name: Roomy and Comfy

name: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Marmot Chelsea Down Coat - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chelsea Down Coat - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Chelsea Down Coat - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Warm, flattering, and has pockets! This coat is great! Love the removable hood. So far this coat has kept me warm and dry in some -14 temps and blowing snow. Love the length!!! Also appreciate the warm cuffs. Nice touch. I got the green color to mix things up and its a nice, soft, green, like moss or lichen.
review.name: Versatile, Warm Coat for Cold Weather

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Pacific Northwest winters are cold, rainy and snowy.  I was looking for a long coat that would be waterproof, warm, and stylish enough to wear going out to dinner. This coat checks all of the boxes! This is the best, multifunctional coat I have ever purchased.
review.name: Great style, warm and dry

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As many reviewers mentioned, the hood is a very tight fit but I personally don't mind because it means the wind won't be blowing off my hood. The hood's fur, and the hood itself are both removable (which is great because the fur was definitely blocking my vision). The coat runs slightly roomy as I purchased both XS and S and will be keeping the XS (I am 5'6 and 125 lbs). PS - the Urban Army color is the sea green shade and NOT the darker green shade.
review.name: Great Jacket - Tight Hood

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The item itself is well-made, but the sizing and color is off. If you are more petite, even XS is too big for size 2, more like US 4. It is a bit bulky even if you wear a cinched belt, even if the streamlined shape and inside pockets are nice. But the color is completely off, it is not pink nor blush nor dusty rose at all, but a muted drab purple, in warm light, it looks grayish, in white light, a dark purple. I ended up choosing the Columbia Suttle Peach Blossom since it was slightly shorter and more pink (granted this is 700 vs their 650 fill and it feels warmer).
review.name: Dream state is not dusty rose but muted purple

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Well made, warm, and comfortable. I travel around the city and work in several different buildings, so I needed something that would keep me comfortable through the Midwestern winter. This has been a great purchase
review.name: Chelsea Coat in Grey

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very warm coat without being bulky. I am between size medium & large - I definitely needed a size Large for sleeve length & to fit a sweater underneath it. The "pink" color was more like a muted mauve & very pretty. The only reason I didn't rate it 5 stars was for the hood. It fits snugly but comes down too far over my eyes. I would only use the hood if I were really freezing & didn't have to see in front of me.
review.name: Nice & warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love my army color Chelsea coat especially the fur hood its so warm and snug. I got the medium just the right fit if Im not wearing a hoodie or other layered clothing
review.name: Chelsea coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am 5'4", 140lb, with an athletic build and I always run cold.  This coat is sooo warm, fits so well, and is attractive!  The shoulders aren't tight, the length is not restrictive, and I haven't yet needed to layer a fleece underneath it to stay warm in teen-degree weather. My kids and husband, who are generally oblivious to what I wear, complimented me in the coat.  Love it!
review.name: Best Winter Coat Ever

review.reviewBody: Bought the green coat for myself and the black one for my daughter. After arrival she texted me immediately: mom its not only nice but also very warm. Thank you mom!!!
review.name: Very happy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Im so sad to return this coat because I can tell its well made but the hood is so annoying.  It was also really big on me so I should of sized down to a XS. Im 52 118 lbs and ordered size s.
review.name: The hood is much too small.
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. Were available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I have a couple of different models of Sella SMP that I ride on different bikes.  I ride the Crit saddle on my aggressively  set up Felt AR3, the Dynamic on my relaxed Giant Defy and the Glider on my titanium bike (in between). If you buy any SMP saddle, go to their Web site and follow the setup instructions regarding saddle tilt. I would guess a lot of the folks that buy these and dont like them havent set them up properly. I have small/medium sit bones and anything wider than the Dynamic doesnt work for me.
review.name: Set it up properly

review.itemreviewed: Aspero SC Rival AXS 2x Carbon Wheel Exclusive Gravel Bike
review.reviewBody: In less than a month, I have already put close to 500 miles on my Aspero (while still MTB and road riding).  Once you have your preferred tire and saddle setup, this bike is a dream to ride.  Definitely a more race oriented bike, so don't expect to load it up with countless bottle cages and fenders.  Longest ride so far has been just over 50 miles on Colorado's Front Range (endless hills and wind).  Highly recommend for those that want to gravel ride at high speed.
review.name: Functional and beautiful gravel bike!

name: Aspero SC Rival AXS 2x Carbon Wheel Exclusive Gravel Bike

review.reviewBody: The Beach size is ideal for packing in a triathlon gear bag: lightweight, absorbent, sand doesn't get caught in it.
review.name: Triathlon helper

review.reviewBody: This thin, chamois-like towel feels strange at first, but it does a great job of drying your body. It dries out quickly even in humid ocean air. Packs up super small. Long enough to be a beach towel, too.
review.name: Dries you then dries out quickly

review.reviewBody: I used my newpack towel after a swim in a mountain lake on a long hike, and Im very pleased. It is a good size, very soft and absorbent, and so compact. I definitely would recommend this towel.
review.name: Great hiking or travel towel

review.reviewBody: Once I let go of the idea that a towel should be fluffy and cozy, then you really appreciate how quickly this towel dries you, and itself, by the time youre done getting dressed, you can fold the towel back up again, takes up very little space And is ideal for the gym and camping, Great price point for a good product
review.name: First time purchasing a tech towel

review.reviewBody: Regular bath and beach towels are so bulky, and heavier too. This one packed up small in my luggage and worked well absorbing moisture after a shower. I like that its large enough to sit on at a beach and the sand can be shaken off of it, so it can be used for bath or beach. Great travel towel.
review.name: Dont throw in the towel

review.reviewBody: I purchased the beach size towel for an upcoming coastal vacation, where I intend to carry the towel around with me frequently. I do think it takes up little room for the size, however I was hoping it would come with a bag to keep it tight and small, since recent (2023) reviews have commented on their orders being accompanied with a convenient bag. Decreasing one star because I think that a bag would be a great benefit, and was part of the reason for my purchase. I will now need to seek out an appropriately sized bag at an additional cost, which I was not anticipating. I did read the description and notice a bag is not listed, but the comments made me hope/think there would be one. =)
review.name: Good Size - Does Not Come w/ Pack Bag

review.reviewBody: It was a great purchase. Compact, very absorbent, and dries quickly.
review.name: Very satisfied

review.reviewBody: Got it in order to get the sack to go with a towel; nice!
review.name: size and drying great!

review.reviewBody: I bought the towel from the same brand as one that my boyfriend had since his worked so well, so I was disappointed to find that mine was a different material and not nearly as good. Mine was a much thinner fabric than his and did not dry nearly as quickly. It still dried slightly faster than a typical towel, but it was drenched through and I had to put it back in my bag while it was still very wet.
review.name: Not as good as the older version

review.reviewBody: I bought this towel to take on my cruise. It really soaks up the water and repels sand. Love it
review.name: I bought this towel to

name: Personal Towel

review.reviewBody: Like this helmet and provides good value for the price. We're not super serious bikers so this works for us for around town riding.
review.name: Good, entry price helmet

review.reviewBody: Purchased this for my dad, who rarely rides, so I thought a budget helmet would work. He has a pretty big head, which would likely be a Large in most helmets that offer S - XL. Unfortunately, this one size fits all was too small, so I ended up sending it back in order to get a helmet with dedicated sizing. As well, the helmet also looked pretty small, so even if it fit it would have looked like he was wearing a youth helmet. This would be great for older kids and teens who don't need MIPS technology or anything.
review.name: Entry level; runs small

name: Supra Helmet

review.reviewBody:
Tried on multiple pairs of La Sportiva G2s.  Couldnt get a solid fit.  Took a chance on these and BAM!  Perfect right out of the box.
Wore them on Mt Baker and Mt Ranier this year.  Both climbs required wearing them right out of the parking lot.  Zero blisters or hot spots.  Tough as nails!
I wear a mens 12 in shoes.  These boots are 12.5 UK (13.5) US.  Went up 1.5 on size.
review.name: Excellent

name: Inverno Mountaineering Boot

review.name: Top class

review.reviewBody: Didnt see much about sizing in the other reviews, so offering my 2 cents. I loved the blue hiangles, and thought the sizing would roughly translate. Nope. The whites have a deeper/higher heel and feel vastly different from the blues. There is extra heel material that also extends higher. Fwiw, I wear 11.5 US in blues. Based on the size chart, I thought the same would work in the whites. Too small, not even close.
review.name: Sizing vastly different from the Blues

review.reviewBody: Incredible all rounder. Soft enough to have sensitivity but the stiff edge never deforms and maintains that precise toeing throughout the lifetime of the shoe.
review.name: Greatest performance all rounder.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this model to replace my beloved gray/yellow synthetic HiAngles.  A lot has changed with this model since then.  The wider forefoot is great for my flat, wide feet, however the higher volume creates a lot of dead space....I should've went with the LV version but I'm satisfied with the fit overall.  After reading reviews about sizing, I went with size 12 for a comfortable long session fit (street shoe is 11.5).  After a few sessions, I feel like 11.5 would've been fine, and maybe 11 for a true performance fit.  Overall, I'm very please with this version.
review.name: Excellent bouldering shoe.

review.reviewBody: Good for climbing, a little narrow, but maybe become bigger later
review.name: Good style

review.reviewBody: They fit more in the smaller side and they have great performance!
review.name: They fit small and have great performance!

review.reviewBody:
Hard to size right but theyre pretty consistent once you figure out that sizing measures 30mm shortwr than the stated chn size. Just put your foot against a ruler and scrunch to about the amount youre looking for add 30 mm to that and thats the size youre going to want to buy. Size 9 street shoe went with 11.5, stated size was 285 and the shoe came in measuring roughly 255 inside with a tape measure heel to toe. Super comfortable shoe once on though definitely tight, soft, heel can run deep so dont be afraid to be aggressive. 260mm in black d hurt me for awhile but 255 in hiangle broke in fast. Toe box volume is high in expectation of toe curl so factor that in. Heel hooks fantastic, bicycles lock in securely as the shoe fits extremely snug whilst staying comfortable. 

I wish there was a second closure strap and a midsole strip. A laced option would also be welcome imo but the split velcro would be a huge game changer for me if it were incorporated in the retail model
review.name: -30mm stated size

name: Hiangle Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, functional, and easy to care for. Not to mention cute!
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: This is a fun in-between jacket, a not-too-cold but breezy day light jacket.
review.name: Love the color and the retro look of it!

review.reviewBody: The Swiftbreaker fits easily - oversized with an adjustable drawstring. Definitely most comfortable with a long sleeve underneath as the ripstop polyester is not the most cozy. We love an oversized but almost cropped adjustable 90s throwback anorak vibe! Three sweet color sets to choose from, easy to pair with most fits. Would not recommend the Snow/Dawn for anyone getting after it in the mud.... The Swiftbreaker really brings it on the feature front. Two sets of snaps on the front pocket, a separate zipper kangaroo pouch, easy to access cross-body pocket, and a breathable mesh section on the back to keep overheating to a minimum. Not your lightest weight windbreaker option, the Swiftbreaker excels as a casual and cute windbreaker - but isn't the best choice for your ultralight ultramarathon gear kit.
review.name: cute layer for urban/casual adventures

name: Swiftbreaker Shell - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is a very middle of the road jersey. Material is a little thicker, but still comfortable in the summer. It is also soft with a good amount of stretch. The sizing runs a bit looser than I prefer (6'0" 180lb) but I would still call it a standard size. The zipper pocket is always nice for cards and cash. I picked up last years dark blue when it was on sale; the overall style is very minimal and nice (for my taste). Overall a very solid jersey that I would pick up again next time it goes on sale.
review.name: A Decent Jersey

name: New Road Jersey - Men's
